skill_description: The Amazon Math skill offers an easy and fun way for kids to practice math. Kids choose their current grade level from Kindergarten through 5th grade and can choose from a variety of topics, including addition, multiplication, comparing, rounding, and more! Kids complete sets of 5 math problems and can choose to focus on a specific topic or do a mix of topics. Alexa keeps track of scores and progress and can increase or decrease the difficulty of a topic as needed. Alexa can even take turns counting with you, by any number, and will celebrate when you reach counting goals.   Once you're in the skill, you can use the following commands to help you navigate: Repeat/Say it again - Hear the question again Change Topic - Alexa will switch to a different, grade-appropriate topic Harder/Easier- Alexa will move you up or down in difficulty List all Topics - Find out all the different topics you can choose from What's my score? - Get the total score for the session Change Grade - If another user from a different grade wants to play

Let your Smart Speaker help you potty train! The Pull-Ups® Voice Skill for Smart Speakers has potty reminders, positive reinforcement, and Disney character interactions to help make potty training a fun bonding experience. Pull-Ups® Voice Assistant Makes Potty Training Fun, Fast & Easy for Everyone!   - Big Kid Fun: Motivate your toddler to potty train by calling Disney characters and and playing songs to celebrate milestones   - Mom's Must-Have Potty Training Assistant: Get Daily Tips, answers to potty training questions, and potty break reminders right on your Smart Speaker. You can even use the App on the go.   - Encouragement and Bonding: This is a unique experience for you & your Big Kid. Create a partnership that will celebrate all the milestones of growing up!   Things You Can Ask the Pull-Ups® Voice Skill “Call a Disney® Character” so your toddler can hear encouragement from their favorite characters   “Set a potty break reminder” so you don’t have to stop and ask your toddler   “Give me a tip of the day” so you can get the support you need to guide your child through potty training   “Celebrate” or “Play the handwashing song” to play music that reinforces your Big Kid’s actions
Fun, Cool and Interesting Words

You decide what happens next in these classic Choose Your Own Adventure® stories brought to you by Audible. In each professionally narrated story, you are the adventurer who makes the choices that decide your fate. To help you on your journey: Say “go back” to go back one scene if you don't like the choice you made. Say “start over” to start your current story over from the beginning. Say “change story” if you are ready to switch to another story. Say "skip" if you want to skip part of the story. If you need help, just ask. Stories available from the original series: *Newly added* Mystery of the Maya by R. A. Montgomery Space and Beyond by R.A. Montgomery The Abominable Snowman by R. A. Montgomery Journey Under the Sea by R. A. Montgomery Adapted to audiobook by Audible based on original titles © Chooseco LLC. Features: 40 total endings in Mystery of the Maya 27 total endings in The Magic of the Unicorn 43 total endings in Space and Beyond 28 total endings in The Abominable Snowman 37 total endings in Journey Under the Sea Progress tracking and automatic bookmarking for resuming later Choose Your Own Adventure® is compatible with FreeTime devices if you grant permissions to the skill at parents.amazon.com or visit the FreeTime section of the Alexa app. Issues? Feedback? We want to hear from you. Send us a note: audible-cyoa@audible.com

Let’s teach our kids (and ourselves) to be thankful for every drop of water. Let them know how much water is wasted every day, and how to conserve it. Let them know how millions of people around the world have to walk miles, to just get a bucket of water. With an interesting , kid-friendly quiz format, WW teaches our kids and us, about how precious water is, and the ways we could adopt, to conserve this priceless resource. Look forward to your feedback – chatandsharefeedback@gmail.com You can say: "Alexa, open Water Wise" "Alexa, start Water Wise" "Alexa, launch Water Wise"

Math Machine is a simple game that challenges both your concentration and math skills. Once you launch the skill, you can choose from two activities. Math Facts can be used to drill basic math operations, such as "5 plus 6" or "4 times 8". Just say, "Play math facts," or "Test addition facts up to five." Operations Challenge will test your concentration and math speed. You will start with a simple problem, such as "5 minus 3," but each successive problem will add another operation. How far can your skills take you? Just say, "Play the operations challenge," or "Try the operations challenge with five operations" to get started. If you didn't hear a problem, just ask Alexa to repeat it. NOTE: For the Operations Challenge, all operations should be performed in the order in which they are spoken, so 5 - 2 * 3 should be calculated as 5 - 2 = 3, then 3 * 3 = 9.

Welcome to Short Bedtime Stories by Al Summers Media. This skills offers a selection of short bedtime sleep stories. Want to launch the skill? Just say: "Alexa, open bedtime stories and list all stories" or "Alexa, open bedtime stories and play all stories". At the moment the skill offers the following bedtime stories:  1) Tyler meets Santa 2) Joy teaches kindness 3) Danny's ocean adventure 4) Jessica bakes cake 5) Dental heroes 6) Alfi blows bubbles 7) Goldilocks and three bears 8) Little Pirate Joe 9) Cinderella  10) My Travelling Adventures  (kids decide how the story develops) 11) Halloween Treasure Hunt  ✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶BRAND NEW✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶ Play a personalised children's story - ask for example "play personalised story" or "play my personal story". Please be aware that only English names can processed... NEW FEATURES: ► say "spin the wheel" to play a random bedtime story ► say "Alexa Next" to skip a story ► say"Alexa Repeat" to repeat a story ► say "Alexa Previous" to go back to the previous story Please leave a rating if you love this skill. Please report bugs via our website. We welcome your feedback!

Bamboo Learning is the 1st comprehensive learning program for children in grades K–5 on Alexa. With up to 6 users per family, Bamboo Learning brings together all of the great exercises and content from our award-winning Alexa skills—Bamboo Math, Bamboo Books & Bamboo English—in a fun game-like experience. Bamboo Learning reflects standard US K–5 curriculum. Bamboo Learning includes math, phonics, spelling, grammar, vocabulary, listening comprehension with 20 free and 30 subscription-based audiobooks (with more added each month). Bamboo Learning now includes a human-narrated Panda to welcome kids to Bamboo Learning each day, praise them for correct answers, and gently nudge them to try again, if they're incorrect. Panda also celebrates their accomplishments; children earn Bamboo tokens (complete with sound effects), which keeps kids interested in returning to learn more using Bamboo Learning’s self-paced activities. Images and text are available for Echo Show & Fire TV products. BOOKS & LISTENING COMPREHENSION Bamboo Learning offers 20 free and 30 subscription-based books for kids to listen to and follow along with words and pictures on screen-based Alexa devices like Echo Show and Fire TV. New books will be added each month as part of the Bamboo Learning Plus subscription. Please see "What's New" section or our website for a full list of books. Bamboo Learning listening comprehension exercises incorporate questions into 50 narrated books (as of May 2021) for grades K–5. These exercises help children improve their ability to understand elements of the books, including characters, plot, and details. Listening skills are key to improving reading and writing. On screen-based Alexa devices, text and pictures enhance the experience.  LANGUAGE ARTS Bamboo Learning Language Arts program follows the curriculum used in the majority of elementary schools throughout the US, including thousands of phonics, spelling, grammar, and vocabulary exercises in the form of word games. Examples include: Phonics: Which word rhymes with BOUNCE – ANNOUNCE or BEHIND? (Grade 2) Spelling: In the word CAT, is the last letter T? (Grade 1) Grammar: This movie is exciting. Which word is an adjective? (Grade 3) Vocabulary: If you add the letters -ER at the end of the word PAINT, what word do you get? (Grade 2) MATH Bamboo Learning Math offers tens of millions of math problems for kids in grades K–5, with 3 learning modules – Numbers (e.g., counting), Operations (+, -, x, ÷), and Measurement, Time, & Money. Problems feature a fun mix of animals (e.g., tarantulas, octopuses, penguins) & objects (e.g., flashlights, alarm clocks, umbrellas). Children with screen-based Alexa devices see images that enhance the experience. Examples include: Numbers: What number goes between 6 and 8? (Kindergarten) Operations: 4 penguins are watching a sunset. 3 zebras joined them. How many animals are watching the sunset? (Grade 1) Measurement/Money/Time: How many days are in March and April combined? (Grade 4) - MULTI-USER: Up to 6 users, so each child can learn at their own pace. Free version includes most of the basic and many of the grade-level activities for each subject, and 20 free books for kids in K–5. Bamboo Learning Plus subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes full access to all basic, grade-level, and advanced activities in all subjects, and 50 books (as of May 2021), with more added each month. - IS BAMBOO LEARNING FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo Learning to use basic and some grade level activities at no cost. Bamboo Learning Plus (an optional subscription) provides the complete Bamboo Learning curriculum including all basic, grade level, and advanced activities. - REVIEWS If you love this skill, give us a customer review in the Alexa skills store! - CHECK OUT OUR USER GUIDE AT guide.bamboolearning.com. - ACCOUNT LINKING Parents can sign up for a Bamboo Grove (“dashboard”) account at grove.bamboolearning.com to follow kids' progress

Bamboo Books offers narrated stories and exercises to help children improve listening comprehension. For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading along with Alexa. (NOTE: If you are using Fire tablets, make sure to say “Alexa switch to Show Mode.” before saying “Alexa, open Bamboo Books.” so that you can experience all of the text and images.) Bamboo Books includes selections from classic children’s books & stories such as: Level 1 • The Little Red Hen by Florence Williams • Little Red Riding Hood by Unknown Author • Rumpelstiltzkin by Unknown Author • The Story of the Three Little Pigs by Unknown Author • The Story of the Three Bears by Robert Southey Level 2 • The Story of Doctor Dolittle by Hugh Lofting • The Elephant's Child by Rudyard Kipling • The Jungle Book by Rudyard Kipling • Peter Pan by J. M. Barrie • The Tale of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter Level 3 • Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll • Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain • The Railway Children by Edith Nesbit • Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson • The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum Exercises and questions help children practice listening for characters, plot, setting, details, and more. There are 3 different levels to offer an engaging experience for pre-readers, early, intermediate, and advanced readers. Even adults will enjoy practicing their ability to remember details using only their listening skills. WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO BOOKS AT guide.bamboolearning.com. Keep checking back periodically for more books! BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is where parents can go to follow their children’s progress, including correct and incorrect answers for each book, and badges awarded. After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents will need to link that account with the Bamboo Books Alexa skill. Parents can do this by opening the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then searching for Bamboo Books within the skills section of the Alexa App. After finding Bamboo Books in the Alexa App, select “Settings”, and then “Link Account”. A screen with a Bamboo logo will show up. Sign in to the previously created Bamboo Learning account and Bamboo Books will be linked. After that, visit Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com to view progress.

skill_name: Math Facts - Math Practice for Kids
skill_description: Math Facts gives you practice for addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Just open Math Facts, choose your operation, and you'll get a set of five questions. If you get all five right, expect a silly surprise. This skill makes math practice fun for the whole family! The skill has been refined through extensive kid testing for accuracy and precision in listening to responses. It's perfect for math practice while you're staying home. Try it out and see the results!

As someone who has a child with sensory processing disorder, we often need to utilize different strategies to help calm down during a meltdown or in crowds. These are similar strategies Occupational Therapists use to help people with anxiety and sensory processing disorders. When helping our child with these strategies, we found that it also really helped adults as well.  These strategies help with anger episodes, anxiety, meltdowns, tension. Even if you do not have any of  diagnoses, this information can still be very helpful. Anytime any of these situations begin, just say "Alexa, open sensory seeker," and a helpful strategy will be provided to help calm down. Between our echo devices and echo auto, it makes using this skill helpful in many areas. skill_name: Kid-do Multiplication - Times Table Learning Skill
skill_description: Kid-do Multiplication is a fun based multiplication learning skill for children of all ages, particularly those from 3 to 12 years. Skill provides features for learning, practicing and testing the time table or multiplication skills. Skill will start by using any of the following phrases.   'Alexa, start Table Robo' 'Alexa, open Table Robo'  'Alexa, launch Table Robo' Skill will ask user to select the mode i.e. Learn / Practice / Test. In learning mode, Alexa shall recite the times table for any chosen number from amongst 1 to 20.   In Practice mode, Alexa shall ask times table for any chosen number from amongst 1 to 20. Alexa shall offer help when asked. Also Alexa shall automatically provide the correct response when repeated mistakes are made. In testing mode, Alexa shall ask user to select a difficulty level from 1 till 5. Lower difficulty levels are suitable for relatively junior students and higher levels for senior students. Test shall comprise of 10 questions being asked one after the other. Best of Luck Kid! Good fun and great learning to you!

Simply choose your grade level (1-8) to get started. The words are taken from the Scripps spelling bee word lists.  You can ask to repeat the word, definition, etymology, and example sentence. Speak each letter loudly and clearly as there’s only one chance to spell it correctly just like the Scripps National Spelling Bee! Like you, I am a parent of a child who loves to learn words and compete in his school spelling bee. I would spend hours giving him words to spell and realized there should be an Alexa skill for this. After several sessions with Beewhiz on Alexa, my child can now beat me at this skill!

Come back each week to listen to the new message. 4C Kids is the children's ministry of Four Corners Church. We create safe, fun, and engaging environments to partner with parents in raising kids who love Jesus. We offer classes for infants through 4th graders that meets during each service at Four Corners Church. Our services are at 9:15 & 11:00 am at 7740 Service Center Drive, West Chester, OH 45069.  You can pause and play by saying "Alexa, pause" and "Alexa, resume." Just say "Alexa, stop" when you're done for the day. When listening to podcasts you can say "Alexa, shuffle" to shuffle the playing order, or "Alexa, loop" to loop the current episode. You can also ask for previous and next episodes by saying "Alexa, previous" and "Alexa, next".

Mornings are hard, but mornings with kids are harder. Parents have enough to deal with on their own when they start the day, but with a little help from Ready Freddy, they will have time to address their own needs (like sleep) and be able to teach their kids independence. Ready Freddy is an Amazon Alexa skill created to make mornings less hectic. Ready Freddy feels like a game to kids and an extra set of hands to parents. When launched, Ready Freddy guides children through morning tasks like brushing their teeth and getting dressed. Designed for kids in kindergarten to third grade, the skill is easy to start and exciting to use. Kids will love their new morning sidekick, and parents will love having time to swallow their coffee. Ready Freddy helps parents take the mornings back and gets kids out the door faster than ever before.

Bamboo Math is designed to reflect elementary school curriculum covering grades K through 5. Bamboo Math is divided into three learning modules – Number Sense (counting, place values, number patterns), Operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division; word & number problems), and Measurement, Time, & Money (linear, volume, money, calendar, time). Learning modules are divided into units. Each round of math exercises includes problems from more than one module. Problems feature a fun mix of animals (e.g., tarantulas, octopuses, penguins, & more) and objects (flashlights, alarm clocks, umbrellas, & more). Children with a screen-based Alexa device (i.e., Echo Show, Fire TV, Fire tablet) see images that enhance the learning experience. --- MULTI-USER SUPPORT: Families can set up accounts for up to 6 users, so each child can learn at their own pace. The free version includes most of the basic and many of the grade level problems for each math learning module, for children in Kindergarten through 5th grade. The paid subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes full access to all basic, all grade level, and all advanced math exercises in all K–5 Bamboo Math learning modules. Content includes math exercises and problems from leading content providers. --- IS BAMBOO MATH FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo Math exercises at no cost. --- REVIEWS If you love this skill, please let us know by giving us a customer review in the Alexa skills store! --- MORE INFO ON BAMBOO MATH Examples of exercises & problems include: Number Sense - What number goes between 6 and 8? (Kindergarten) - Is 785 odd or even? (4th Grade) Operations - 4 penguins are watching a sunset. 3 zebras joined them. How many animals are watching the sunset? (1st Grade) - What is 325 - 456? (5th Grade) Measurement/Money/Time:  - Which object is bigger -- a mountain or a flower? (Kindergarten) - How many days are in March and April combined? (4th Grade) Note: To make things easier for children to understand, we refer to each grade level as climbing one of the following trees (K – Banana Tree, 1 – Coconut Tree, 2 – Apple Tree, 3 – Oak Tree, 4 – Pine Tree, 5 – Lemon Tree). As children progress through the units in Numbers, Operations, and Measurement, Time, & Money, they advance from lower to higher levels on each tree. --- WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO MATH AT guide.bamboolearning.com. --- BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is the dashboard where parents can follow their children’s progress in Bamboo Math. After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents must link that account with the Bamboo Math Alexa skill using the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com), and then searching for Bamboo Math within the skills section of the Alexa App.

skill_name: Animal Game for Kids - Play and Learn
skill_description: Probably the best animal sounds game on Amazon Alexa! Play alone, or with friends and family.  The game is quick. Just five sounds to guess.  Animal sounds game was created to help children of all ages learn animal sounds while having fun at the same time. Skill includes most loved animals like dog, cat, sheep, elephant, lion, owl, wolf and even fox. Older girls, boys, and even small toddlers will have a great time! Learn the noises, of pets, farm, and wild animals and birds. Only real sounds effects, voices, calls and cries of animals. Do you know animal’s sounds? Do you know what does the fox say? Take this fun challenge now! Let's Take This Animal Sounds Quiz. Play and Learn.  UPDATE: The new updated version of the free Animal Game. Now you can ask Alexa for a hint! Anytime during the animal game, you can say: "give me a hint", or "I don't know" and Alexa will help you. When it comes to your child, teaching them all of the exciting, funny, and interesting sounds that animals make is one of the most important children’s games to play for their development! Animal sounds help children begin to relate to the world around them and understand the differences between the whole animal kingdom!  Now for Amazon Alexa, let your child play alone or with friends! Developed for kids of all ages, your child can learn animal sounds and have fun all at the same time. Teach your child how to identify animal sounds from dogs, cats, sheep, elephants, lions, owls, wolves, and even foxes! And trust us, in no time at all, they’ll have every last animal sound down without a hint.

Few things are as an important a part of a child's education as fostering creativity. However, a child cannot be "taught" to be creative. It is a talent they must discover for themselves. My Fairy Tale helps lead them on that path to discovery. Rather than read a story out to your child, My Fairy Tale lets the child create their own adventure, filled with whatever fantasies they come up with. The skill helps them create their story line-by-line, with words of encouragement after each addition to the story. Once the child says, "The End", the skill stitches together everything they've said so far, and reads the story back to them.

The Tale of Peter Rabbit, written by Beatrix Potter,  is an ageless children's story.  It's told by Alexa as only she can.  Suitable for children of all ages with some 'yes' or 'no' interactions so the listener can feel part of the tale. NOTE TO PARENTS:  There may be some words unfamiliar to children such as currants (like raisins but smaller), gooseberry net (gooseberries are red berries found on bushes, the net protects the berries from rabbits), sieve (a fine mesh used, in this case, as a bucket to get the rocks out of soil) . If you think this story would be more engaging if Alexa asked the listener questions or explained the meaning of the words in the story, please be sure to  comment in the review section of your Alexa app on your phone. If you would like other classic stories read by Alexa, please also leave your thoughts in the comments of your review. Story time is about six minutes. Thank you and we hope you enjoy The Tale of Peter Rabbit.
Wake up with your friends Josh, Blue, and Tickety Tock!

Math facts helps you to sharpen your math skills in a simple playful way that the kids would love. It works even better on display devices. Typical usage Just say "Alexa Open Math Facts" to get started

Kids News provides fun entertaining daily current events, science and other types of news for children of all ages! News is updated daily.  Kids News updates are short and fun and meant to be educational and/or inspiring.  Here's an example of one of the daily Kids News snippets: "ZOO GETS AN ADORABLE HOLIDAY PRESENT - The Potter Park Zoo in Michigan welcomed a new baby on Christmas Eve. A black rhino calf was born! Only around 5,500 black rhinos exist in the wild. The calf’s parents are Doppsee and Phineus, but the baby isn’t named yet. Black rhinos and white rhinos are both gray. They just have different lip shapes!" We hope you and your children enjoy it and learn fun facts, science, art, current events and more!! The news is read by Alexa, so it will be a friendly voice for kids.

Bamboo English offers thousands of English Language Arts (ELA) exercises in the form of word games for children age 5 to 11, covering five core ELA modules (Vocabulary, Grammar, Spelling, Phonics, & Listening/Reading).  --- MULTI-USER SUPPORT: Families can set up accounts for up to 6 different users, so each child can learn at their own pace. Content available includes free access to Unit 1 of 6 for each ELA module, for each grade from Kindergarten through 5th Grade. The paid subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes all six units (Unit 1 through Unit 6) for each ELA module, for each grade from K–5. Modules include basic, grade level, and "reach" exercises so children can move at their own pace through the ELA curriculum. Content includes lessons and exercises from leading content providers. --- IS BAMBOO ENGLISH FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo English exercises at no cost. We offer a subscription to gain access to all 6 of 6 Units for each of 5 ELA modules, for each grade – K–5. --- CONNECTING WITH BAMBOO LEARNING To learn more about Bamboo Learning, connect with us on Instagram: @learnwithbamboo; Facebook: @bamboolearning; Twitter: @learnwithbamboo; Email: info@bamboolearning.com --- MORE INFO ON BAMBOO ENGLISH •Phonics exercise examples: “Which word rhymes with BOUNCE – ANNOUNCE or BEHIND?”; “She took the crown into town. Which words rhyme?” •Spelling exercise examples: “In the word CAT, is the last letter T?”; “In the word FISH, take out F and put in D. What word do you get?”  •Grammar exercise examples: “We hiked up the mountain. Which word is a verb?”; “What is the antonym of TOGETHER – UNIFIED or DIVIDED?”  •Vocabulary exercise examples: “What does the word ANTICIPATION mean? A) Looking forward to something, or B) Ability to move objects with the mind.”; “If you add the letters -ER at the end of the word PAINT, what word do you get?” Bamboo English includes dozens of books leveled for each grade, both for fun, and for children to practice listening and reading comprehension. Examples include: •Fairy Tales such as: The Hare and the Tortoise and The Emperor's New Clothes •Short Stories such as: Little Red Riding Hood, Cinderella, and The Elephant’s Child •Selections from longer works such as: Aladdin, Peter Pan, and Wonderful Wizard of Oz •Highlights Readers such as: The Lucky Penny, The Skeleton Crew, and Balto The Sled Dog For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading and following along with Alexa. Note: To make things easier for children to understand, we refer to each grade level as climbing one of the following trees (K – Banana Tree, 1 – Coconut Tree, 2 – Apple Tree, 3 – Oak Tree, 4 – Pine Tree, 5 – Lemon Tree). Additionally, we refer to each “Unit” as climbing a ladder. So, a child working on the 3rd Unit of 2nd grade for Spelling, would be on “Ladder 3 on the Apple Tree in Spelling”. Similarly, a child working on the 6th Unit of 4th grade for Vocabulary, would be on “Ladder 6 on the Pine Tree in Vocabulary.” If they complete this ladder, they would move to “Ladder 1 on the Lemon Tree in Vocabulary” (i.e. 5th Grade, Unit 1). --- WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO ENGLISH AT guide.bamboolearning.com. --- BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is the "dashboard" where parents can go to follow their children’s progress for each unit and level (for example 2nd Grade Vocabulary Unit 3 would be the 3rd Unit of the school year for 2nd Grade Vocabulary). After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents need to link that account with the Bamboo English Alexa skill using the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then searching for Bamboo English within the skills section of the Alexa App.

Use this skill to keep track of chores that are assigned to each member of your household. You can ask Alexa to read the list of chores that are assigned to you each day, and you can log your chores as you complete them. Alexa automatically keeps score so you can complete with family members to see who finishes their chores first. Or last! The chore tracker automatically resets on Sunday each week. Louie has the loudest voice anyone has ever heard. He drives the other animals crazy. But one dramatic event teaches everyone that we all have a voice that matters!  Perfect for the whole family...bedtime reading will never be the same! With Story Theater, your child will read along, read aloud and become part of the adventure.  This impressive production features sound effects, voice actors, music, ambient backgrounds and a narrator...all triggered by your child's voice.  If they love to read, this will enhance the experience.  If they don't like reading, this might be the tipping point that makes it more enjoyable.  It's a truly magical experience.
Kids can listen to amazing bedtime stories

From the team that helped a three year old go from phonics to reading at a second grade level comes "Letter H. "   Letter H. assesses and the concept of phonics and allows early English readers to practice identifying words that start with "H." to improve phonic fluency.

skill_name: Pledge of Allegiance (US) Multiple Voice Options
skill_description: Choose from one of five voice options to accompany you while you recite the U.S. Pledge of Allegiance. Voice options: Logan, Olivia, Jordan, Noah and Mia.  Logan and Olivia are adult voices. Jordan is a genderless voice. Noah and Mia are younger voice options. A voice preference can be set. Bugle options: on/off. A preference can be set to play a bugle just before the Pledge of Allegiance begins. You will be asked to pick a voice and a bugle option the first time you use this skill and they will be saved as preferences for future sessions.  During future sessions, you can say, "Alexa, change preferences" to change your preferences. ____________________ Pledge of Allegiance: I pledge allegiance  to the Flag  of the United States of America,  and to the Republic  for which it stands,  one Nation  under God,  indivisible,  with liberty  and justice for all. ____________________ Updates: April 10, 2019: Added a genderless voice option (Jordan), and an optional bugle which plays before the Pledge of Allegiance begins.  Added ability to save these choices as user preferences during first session. Added a command, "Change Preferences", enabling users to change their preferences during subsequent visits. ____________________ Please leave a five-star review if you like this skill, and please include your comments and suggestions for improvement.  Your review will help us continue to improve this skill. ____________________ Credits: Development: https://voices.app Linguistics Consultant: LaLa Speights Icon Image: DepositPhotos

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

This app works by you asking "Alexa,give me a math fact" and then Alexa will give you a step-by-step process in solving it.

JumpStart is the leader in creating interactive family experiences that enrich, entertain, and educate for both home and school. Jumpstart's resource library includes a collection of fun, free and printable worksheets to learn and practice math, science, reading, grammar, social studies, geography, and more. JumpStart's worksheets cover every topic you can think of, with fun characters and themes built around JumpStart characters, holidays and more. It's a great resource to help kids of different grades, from preschool to 6th grade, develop fundamental skills that they need to get a JumpStart in school. To use this skill say "Alexa, open Jumpstart Academy" Followed by - Print me a math worksheet - Print me a coloring sheet PRINTER DISCOVERY To print with Alexa, your printer must be connected to the same wireless network as your Alexa device. To get started, first you’ll need to connect your printer to Alexa. Simply say “Alexa, discover my printer”, or navigate to the Devices screen in the Alexa App, select “+”, select “Add Device”, and choose “Printer” as the device type. Learn more at https://www.amazon.com/alexaprint

Kids Booklet teaches various subjects like Numbers, Multiplication Tables, addition and subtraction. Following things can be taught. Example Phrases 1) Alexa open Kids Booklet 2) Teach Me in Addition 3) Test me in Subtraction 4) Teach Me Multiplication table 5) What subjects do you teach 6) Teach me numbers 7) Test Me in Addition 8) Test me in Numbers 9) Teach me Numbers 10) Test Me in Multiplication Table

Welcome to Music Bop Adventures! This Alexa Kids Skill features fun, interactive adventures that encourages movement whilst also incorporating educational themes. There are currently 4 adventures to explore with more adventures available: 1. Space – Hop into a spaceship and zoom into outer space; dance and sing along to the names of the planets in a fun song. 2. Under the Sea - Hop into a submarine and explore the wonders of the sea; bump into various sea creatures, tackle obstacles and sing along with a featured friend. 3. Jungle – Hop into a super jet and explore the wonders of the jungle; swim across the river, avoid wild animals and sing along with a featured friend. 4. Weather - Hop into a super jet and tinker with a weather machine; tackle the different weather types as they come. ----------------------------- GOLD SUBSCRIPTION ----------------------------- 5. Sky Adventure 6. Cave Adventure 7. North Pole Adventure 8. Dinosaur Adventure 9. Pirate Adventure Each adventure begins with the same theme tune. To begin the adventures, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play adventures” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to shuffle adventures” To play one specific adventure, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Space adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Under the Sea adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Jungle Adventure”
Have Alexa quiz you on division. You can decide how many questions are asked, and when you are done, you can check the full report to see the right answers, and which questions you got right.

Fun Animal Facts is all about fun and interesting animal facts for kids. Let your kids learn about animals in easy to remember bite size  facts. Teaching kids in bite size chunks makes in fun, interesting and engaging and when they are having fun learning, the facts start to stick! Your kids can ask as many questions as they want and will learn about a broad range of animals, insects, sea creatures and more through fun facts.   We are constantly adding to this "skill" to grow every kids general knowledge about the world we share with some amazing creatures and hopefully along the way grow a healthy respect and care for the planet and all its inhabitants.  To get started, you can say any of the following phrases: "Alexa, open Fun Animal Facts" "Alexa, start Fun Animal Facts" "Alexa, launch Fun Animal Facts" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at support@cogentmarketer.com   Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks a bunch for your support.

Sight Words provides children with an interactive platform to learn how to read.  Learning all 1,000 words within the Sight Words list would enable a child to read about 90% of the words in a typical English book, magazine, newspaper, or website. This skill currently supports grade 1 level reading words but will soon be updated to included grade levels 2 to 9.  *NOTE: This skill was designed to work best with Alexa devices that support a display (i.e., Echo Spot and Echo Display). However, if you do not have a display enabled device then you can use the Alexa App or Website to view cards.

Have a hard time getting your child to brush their teeth? Getting your young child to properly brush their teeth can be a daily challenge. Save thousands of dollars on future dental bills with the Alexa 'toothbrush adventure' skill. Invoke the skill with "Alexa start toothbrush adventure". Say "Begin" when prompted and Alexa will play a friendly song to guide you through brushing your teeth thoroughly. You can pause the song with "Alexa stop" and resume the song where it left off with "Alexa resume". No more fuss when it comes to getting your child to brush their teeth! Happy brushing

A parent or guardian is required to provide permission to use this skill. Amazon will verify you’re an adult via confirmation of your credit card CVV or via text message if you have a phone number on file. Your credit card will not be charged. Once permission is granted, just try saying “Alexa, where’s Santa”. NORAD Tracks Santa is Santa’s official tracker. On December 24th NORAD conducts a special mission tracking Santa across the globe and keeping him safe. Find out how many days are left until Santa begins his yuletide journey, follow him as he gets ready the day before his flight and hear his location as we track him across the globe on December 24th. You can also get facts from the Top-Secret Santa files. Only Santa knows when he will arrive at your house, but we do know he only arrives when children are asleep. Find out more about how NORAD tracks Santa at https://noradsanta.org/
The best animal sounds app featuring over 70 animals.  Great for the kids to play along with.

Multiplication Dojo can be used to help you practice your multiplication tables! This skill allows users to choose which multiplication table they want to practice, and then randomly generates ten multiplication questions using the specified number. Immediate feedback is one of the keys to effective learning, and in this app, each response is met with either a "Correct!", or an "Incorrect," as well as what the correct answer should have been. At the end of the ten questions, the user is given a final score of how many questions they answered correctly.
Learn to spell! Test your knowledge of spelling words by taking short spelling quizes. Climb the leaderboard to become the best speller in your grade. To start, just say "Alexa, start Spelling Test."

This skill "Teach My Child" is a Single Window system to learn pre - school basics which consists of  three Sections:  LEARN, PRACTICE and ASSESSMENT  The LEARNING Section has below categories: 1.Alphabets, 2.Numbers( 1- 10),  3.Number Names (1-10),  4.Colors, 5.Colors with spelling,  6.Basic Shapes,  7.Basic Shapes with Spelling,  8.Seasons,  9.Seasons with Spelling,  10.Days of the Week,  11.Days of the Week with spelling,  12.Months of the Year  , 13.Months of the Year  with spelling  14.Magic Words. In the  LEARNING Section, you have options to choose any one of the categories like Alphabets from random letter / Alphabets from start letter to  end letter / Numbers from any random number( 1- 10) / Numbers from start number to end number (1 - 10) / Number name from any random number ( 1 - 10) / Number names from from start number to end number (1 - 10).  The PRACTICE Section has below categories: 1.Alphabet week 1 practice 2.Alphabet week 2 practice  3.Alphabet week 3 practice  4.Alphabet week 4 practice  5.Number week 1 practice  6.Number week 2 practice  In the PRACTICE Section, the skill helps the children to teach the Alphabets / Numbers . The Alphabets has four weeks teach plan and Number has two weeks teach plan.   The ASSESSMENT Section has below categories: 1.Alphabet week 1 Assessment 2.Alphabet week 2 Assessment 3.Alphabet week 3 Assessment 4.Alphabet week 4 Assessment 5.Number week 1 Assessment 6.Number week 2 Assessment 7.     Alphabet Assessment 8      Number Assessment In the PRACTICE Section,  the child's  learning and development can be assessed by ASSESSMENT Section. The Skill can be invoked by 'Alexa, Open Teach My Child' or using the below Utterances. Once the session is invoked, any category by name can be asked to continue the Session. Ex: Alexa,           Open Teach My Child          Ask Teach My Child Alphabets          Ask Teach My Child Alphabets from E         Ask Teach My Child Alphabets from K to P         Ask Teach My Child Numbers          Ask Teach My Child Numbers from 5         Ask Teach My Child Numbers from 4 to 8         Ask Teach My Child Number names          Ask Teach My Child Number names from 3         Ask Teach My Child Number names from 6 to 9         Ask Teach My Child Seasons         Ask Teach My Child Magic words The Skill has other options like  Help and repeat. The help will give the detailed information and the the repeat option in the skill helps to repeat the last content. Note: This skill do not collect any personal information

Toddlebot is a delightful robot who likes to talk to little kids about food, numbers, shapes and more. Suitable for ages 2 - 4 years. Toddlebot will lead the conversation by telling you her favorite color, shape etc. and you can tell Toddlebot what your favorite is. If you match with Toddlebot then she will be happy, if she recognizes what you said then she will acknowledge it. The skill is for young kids who are familiarizing themselves with common words and subjects. Privacy Information No personal information is collected by this skill. The skill only asks for favorite food, meals, shapes, colors, days and numbers. This information is only used within the skill session. The information is not stored or reused anywhere except within the application itself.

Spot the Set is a fun game designed to help build concentration and focus. There are three levels and four rounds per level - followed by a “Super Bonus” level. Players advance rounds by getting three in a row and early ToyBot™ Tokens that can be redeemed for virtual prizes. Levels and round are as follows: Voice level: - Round 1: voice sets - Round 2: speed sets - Round 3: volume sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Word level: - Round 1: Letter sets - Round 2: Color sets - Round 3: Shape sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Sound level: - Round 1: Instrument sets - Round 2: Animal ses - Round 3: Vehicle sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Super Bonus level (unlocked after all prior levels have been completed) Commands - “Change level” - Change levels - “Reset” - Start over - “Tokens” - Hear how many ToyBot™ Tokens earned Why it’s really educational: This experience is designed to build executive function skills such as working memory, flexible thinking, and self control in a fun, engaging way! About SayKid By combining voice technology and tangible play, we help educators and families learn together in a safe, natural, and engaging way - without screens! For more on our innovative approach to screen-free, play-based learning, see our TEDx Talk on our website.  Awards - SayKid wins Grand Prize in the Amazon Alexa EdTech Challenge  - Harvard names SayKid a Finalist in the Saul Zaentz Early Education Challenge - SayKid wins MN Cup "Moonshot" Prize at US Bank Stadium Search "SayKid" on the Alexa Skill Store. If you found the skill helpful, we really appreciate reviews!

Welcome to the future of financial literacy. NuMoola is a family-focused consumer banking app that uses real money, gamified education, and the family network to teach all about managing money, missions, and budgets. NuMoola makes financial literacy fun! NuMoola uses gaming and voice technology to teach the principals and resulting benefits of saving, spending, donating, and investing. Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. skill_name: Indian NCERT Stories collection English and Hindi
skill_description: Many students tend to concentrate more on books that have been published by private publishers and less on the books which have been published by NCERT (National Council of Educational Research and Training). There are doubts amongst students and parents on whether they should do the studies as per the NCERT books or as per other books available in the market. This article will address these questions and help the students and parents to clear their concerns.  National Council of Educational Research and Training is an independent organization of the Government of India set up in India with the sole objective to design and implement a common education system in the entire country. Currently, the role of NCERT is to develop study material for students from class 1 to class 12 which includes the development of NCERT Textbooks, learning material for students, teaching material and reference material for teachers, audio and visual education content, organize various national level examinations and much other useful education material for school level students. NCERT books have been designed in an easy to read and understand format. The teachers in the schools should make the students read and understand the chapters in the schools class room itself. The teachers should make the students understand all the concepts which are given in each chapter. The concentration should be more on making the students understand the topics and concepts more rather than solving the questions which are given at the end of each chapter. The whole purpose of teaching should be to make the student understand the concept and the preparation of the student should be such that if any question comes in the exams from part of the chapter, the student should be able to answer the question from his understanding and not from what he has mugged up. The students should start from plain reading of the chapters followed by a discussion on the topics with the teacher and other students and making sure their understanding is correct followed by solving the questions which are given at the end of the NCERT chapters. The skill presents audio in the Hindi and English Languages.

Quiz of Kanyakumari ,Temples, Ancient, waterfalls, Seas, Ocean and Geography . Compete with like minded people from India and check your knowledge/Trivia. Kanyakumari, also known as Cape Comorin, It is a small coastal town in Tamil Nadu and the southern tip of India.  The waters of the Arabian sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean meet at this very place but the three shades of blue look distinct. The Triveni Sangam is the point from where you can speculate this marvel of nature. It has a coastal line of 71.5 kms stretched on the three sides. This small district is famous on its vast green stretches of paddy fields, coconut groves, Rubber garden and luxurious forests and the rare earth of the western sea shore and stretched valley mountain of the Western Ghats.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. skill_name: LEVOOBA Kids: Educational Multiplayer Voice Battle
skill_description: EDUCATIONAL SINGLE- AND MUTLIPLAYER QUIZ With LEVOOBA Kids kids can train school subjects at home. They virtually get together for challenges - even if they don’t live in the same neighbourhood, have to stay at home because of Corona or are in times of virtual learning. If no one else is there for a voice battle, children can of course also solve quiz questions on their own. LEVOOBA Kids is meant for personal use and will enhance the learning situation of all students while they are at home. NOTE: Multiplayer mode only works after registration on the LEVOOBA website and a successful Account Linking with LEVOOBA Kids. You can do both with your Alexa app. Singleplayer mode does work without any registration or Account Linking. FULL PARENTAL CONTROL Only parents are allowed to set up the LEVOOBA Kids account. They link the account by using the Alexa app. Kids can also play LEVOOBA Kids without accountlinking - the singleplayer mode is always open. SCREEN-FREE DIGITAL LEARNING No reading or writing is necessary – so perfect already for pre-schoolers and first graders. And: LEVOOBA Kids is absolutely screen-free! Kids will learn just by voice-battles. DIVERSE QUESTION TYPES Unlike other voice quizzes LEVOOBA Kids offers multiple options for natural language answers. Instead of only saying answer "a", "b" or "c" kids can give their result after calculating or the letters when spelling straight away. Even whole words and sequences of numbers are possible. LEARN FROM MISTAKES If students give the wrong answer, they get the chance to learn from that. LEVOOBA Kids will explain the correct answer - which helps keeping it in mind. NOTIFICATIONS When a kids challenges another, the preferred opponent will automatically receive a notification. So you’ll always know when someone is challenging you. (Attention: Notifications only work if turned on in the Alexa app. Parents have to guide kids through the process of accepting a challenge.) PHYSICAL ACTIVITY During breaks and waiting periods LEVOOBA Kids encourages physical activity, because physical and mental fitness are tightly linked together. While performing funny activities, the brain turns on its rest mode and will be double the fit for the next voice battle afterwards. TEACHER-FRIENDLY Educators can register their classes for LEVOOBA Kids. They select fitting topics either from our database or they supply their own material. They follow up on the kids' results and learning progress at home, so they can circle it back to their own teaching. LEVOOBA Kids is not designed for classroom usage. It improves digital learning opportunities at home for all students. FEEDBACK What do you think about LEVOOBA Kids? Let us know! You can also contact us with your questions and feedback. If you like playing LEVOOBA Kids, feel free to provide feedback by writing a review or rate the Skill in the Skill store.

Do you want to set your kids up for success? If you do then continue reading. Positive affirmations are phrases/beliefs used to challenge negative or unhelpful thoughts. As children learn behaviours and wire their brain, affirmations are very useful for developing a child's self belief. Every one of us has a strong belief system about the world and ourselves. This was learned from the environment around us. Positive words can help shape this belief system. For example, if your affirmation is "when I fail, I say I can't do it YET, and try again", and you fail at something, the affirmation will trigger in your brain and remind you that you can do it, you just need to keep trying. Without this positive affirmation, you might think that if you fail at something then you can never do it and will just give up without trying again. Simply ask Alexa to get todays positive words for your child. To hear the next word say 'next'

Use LiveHint to get hints to Assignment problems from your Carnegie Learning MATHbook. Make sure you try to solve the problem by yourself first. Ask for another hint or repeat at any time. To get more out of LiveHint: (1) Take your time to listen to and think about the directions and hints. (2) Ask someone to listen to the hints with you.

Hello Math is a mini-game for kids to practice elementary arithmetics. The user can choose from addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or mixed questions. Each round is made up of 10 questions, at the end of which a final score from 0-100 will be given.  - Addition: the answer will be in the range from 0 to 100. - Subtraction: the answer will be in the range from 0 to 100. - Multiplication: the given numbers will be in the range from 0 to 10. - Division: the answer will always be an integer from 1 to 10. Have fun learning! :)

In Hide the Robot, one person hides a robot while the others try to find it. When someone finds the robot, say “I found you” to end the game or “new game” to start again.  Why it’s educational: Kids learn by moving around and searching for a robot. In doing so, they build important gross motor skills in a fun, engaging way! Flywheel's  is changing the current landscape of education. Our mission is to teach you any subject, anywhere, and anytime you want. And we don't want to just "teach" you. We want to teach you in a way that helps you become an expert, and most importantly, have fun in the process. We are starting with two topics:  'Math- Addition', 'Math-Subtraction', ideal for kids ages 4-12.  For our little friends to relax, we have also added a third topic, story time. The teaching starts with Level 1 (single-digit numbers) and auto-upgrades the student to the next level if five consecutive responses are correct. The skill will also keep track of where and how many mistakes you are making, and will take a few minutes to teach the user some helpful tricks. Give it a try! We would love to hear from you on how we did and what can we improve.

If your child can count to ten, they have then they have the ability to add one to at least eight numbers.  You can prove this with the Next Number skill. If they can add one to at least eight numbers they can also add one hundred eight times using their fingers.  This MathHack is designed to help you introduce the concept of counting by hundreds and adding hundreds.  Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten and add one, using their fingers or by memory, this lesson is for you.

When you mix blue and yellow you get green.  Children often learn this concept of blending colors very early in life.  When you mix consonant sounds, by placing two or more consonants next to each other in a word, you end up with blend.  There are many consonant blends and Brainspray has lessons for each.  However, this lesson simply reviews a brief collection of some popular consonant blends.  Before trying this lesson, you should first make sure the student has been through the individual consonant blend lessons.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

If you and your child have completed enough Math Hack lessons, it's time for you to take a Prize Closet challenge.    The Prize Closet challenge in Math Hack is not a typical "quiz", because the questions are designed to balance math problems you are nearly certain your child can answer (one third of the questions), another third of the questions are problems they seem to be gaining proficiency in and the final third are truly challenging questions.   This is a great opportunity for you to reinforce math skills that require practice, help your child reinforce some nearly acquired math skills and assess how close they are to future math concepts.   Most of all, this is a fun and safe environment to introduce your child to the reality that both familiar and new math problems can be solved correctly using different methods.   As your child gores beyond learning their 81 addition facts much sooner than the national average, it's a great time to transition into multiplication and exponents.  Their age doesn't matter (this sample prize closet was successfully completed by a child just before their fourth birthday.

If your child can count to ten, they have then they have the ability to add one to at least eight numbers.  This MathHack from Brainspray is designed to allow your child to start doing that in as little as a day, but on average in about a week. Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this lesson is for you.

Nanak Time is dedicated to anyone who wants to live a beautiful and purposeful life. Inspired from the Mool Mantar composed by Guru Nanak Dev Ji, this app explores universal concepts such as Oneness, Truthful Living and living Without Fear and Hate. Specifically created to work around your busy lifestyle, the app allows you to: * Explore the 9 Gems of Mool Mantar by listening to short Audio Lessons and Guided Meditations * Apply the essence of the Gems to your daily life with simple-to-follow guides and hands-on exercises *Journal your thoughts and experiences * Use the reminders to keep you on track to complete your lessons * Enjoy the ripple effect of the simple exercises designed to impact the community around you Guru Nanak Dev Ji was the first of ten Sikh Guru’s and was born in 1469. He composed many sublime poems through a lifetime of traveling the globe and sharing his enlightened message of Ek Onkar, Oneness. The Mool Mantar is said to be the first composition uttered by Guru Nanak Dev Ji upon enlightenment at the age of about 30. The word ""Mool"" means main or root and ""Mantar"" means chant or verse. Together the words ""Mool Mantar"" mean the ""Main chant"" or ""root verse"" The Mool Mantar is regarded by many as the thesis of his work. Often described as just a summary of the Divine, the Mool Mantar is actually considered to define and carry a deep implication for human existence. Each of the 9 words (Gems) encompass a truly global concept of habits, traits and mindset we should aim to achieve. By explaining the theories and suggesting practical ways to integrate each of the concepts into your daily life, Nanak Time intends to get you started on this journey of discovery and self-reflection. You can pause and play by saying "Alexa, pause" and "Alexa, resume." Just say "Alexa, stop" when you're done for the day. When listening to podcasts you can say "Alexa, shuffle" to shuffle the playing order, or "Alexa, loop" to loop the current episode. You can also ask for previous and next episodes by saying "Alexa, previous" and "Alexa, next".

If your child can count to 25 and you've used MathHack's "Next Number" lesson to help them add one to any number, it's time to move on to adding single digit numbers to double digit numbers.   This means that even if your child isn't in kindergarten yet, but can count to 25 and has succesfully completed the Next Number skill by Brainpsray, they may be able to solve the "81 addition facts" 1st graders aim to achieve. Bigger Number First teaches applies a somewhat new spin to the widespread strategy of adding the biggest (or larger) number first when adding two numbers.  Students using this MathHack are instructed to make a fist with one hand say the larger number, then begin counting up from their using their other hand to add the smaller number. The system, using the Brainspray's Alexa lesson, has taken a child just shy of four years old from being able to add two digits to being able to accurately complete all 81 math facts  within three weeks of starting the program.  Your child may take less time or more time, but they will have a tool that goes beyond rote memorization in their box of solutions needed to master some basic math skills way above schedule. Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to 25 and add one digit, this lesson is for you.

Kids Decisions allows kids from Kindergarten to 5th grade to explore how different decisions impact the outcome of a story. Based on Strengths and Virtues, kids can explore stories related to Wisdom, Courage, Humanity, Transcendence, Justice, and Moderation. You can ask for specific topics and see if Ember has a story for you. For example, you can ask, Alexa, ask Kids Decisions to tell me a story about chocolate.  You can ask for specific virtues and Ember will tell you a story related to that virtue. For example, you can ask, Alexa, ask Decisions for Kids to tell me a story about courage.  Decisions for Kids has a website, http://decisionsforkids.com/, where teachers and parents can craft and submit stories that Ember will use.

Hoggy Missions is a part of the vast Hoggy Universe, now available for free on Alexa to help kids stay at home while having fun. Hoggy is a cute piggy alien that has come from planet Hoggyland to seek help from a Superhero on Earth. Kids get a chance to be a superhero by helping Hoggy on Missions to save Hoggyland from the evil 'Naruko'. Kids participate in highly engaging & interactive missions by being a part of the story and performing actions to move forward in the mission. Alongside fun &good habits, kids also get educational learning- For ex. when they unlock Magical doors by speaking the correct spelling of 'Ice-cream'. Keep your kids busy while you work & rest peacefully. How to go on Missions- 1. Start with 'Hoggy Missions' 2. Follow instructions, try to perform actions as Hoggy tells, to move forward in Missions. Hoggy Missions are Pretend Play, where the kid uses his/her imagination to imagine the world and uses relatable household objects to perform actions in the Mission- Like using a Pencil Eraser as Magic Stones for attacking evil Naruko with Magic, Climbing on the bed to avoid hot Molten Lava or hiding behind the curtains to hide from Naruko's bodyguards.

Cherry Math makes learning basic arithmetic operations fun and engaging. Cherry Math keeps track of your answers, and will periodically ask you those that you missed. The difficulty is adapted automatically, while providing encouraging feedback as you progress. Cherry Math makes learning math efficient and stimulating. Here are some of the basic commands to get you started:  "five questions on additions" "four questions on subtractions" "nine questions on multiplications"                                                                       "three questions on divisions" On multiplications and divisions, you can provide the tables as follows:  "1,2 and 3"                                                                                         "from 2 to 5" "all except 6 and 7" "from 1 to 3 and from 5 to 7" Some of the interactions that Cherry Math will understand: "Random order" - questions to be asked randomly "Ascending order" -  tables questions to be asked in ascending order "Long answers" - for a bit of cheering after each answer "Short answers" - for the pros and impatient ones "Harder" - make questions a bit harder   "Easier" - make questions a bit easier "Boring!" - will stop current series and ask what do to                                                               "Repeat" - repeat last question "Next" - skip to next question "Review" or "Practice" - recently missed questions will be asked "Revise subtractions" - recently missed questions on subtractions will be asked "Score" - will tell your current score                                                                                                                "Close" or "Bye bye" - Cherry Math will leave your place The more Cherry Math gets to know you, the faster you will improve your math skills! Attribution: https://public-cherry-math.s3.amazonaws.com/www/quotes.html Feedback and questions: alexa.cherry.math@gmail.com

skill_name: Whose Turn is it to take out the dog?
skill_description: Next time you're trying to decide whose turn it is pick something or perform a task, just ask Alexa for help. For example, if you're trying to decide whose turn it is to pick a movie on movie night, Alexa can randomly select someone's name from the list. The vowel pattern e. a. most often makes the long e sound, as in eat.  But there are a fair number of exceptions you should practice and this skill can help. The e.a. vowel pattern is pronounced like the long e sound, a single vowel sound.  This means it's technically a monophthong in lingual parlance.  What?  Well, don't worry, you don't need to know all of that to practice identifying words with the e.a. pattern that make the long e sound from words with the e.a. vowel partners that make a different sound, like the long a sound in break or the short e sound in bread.   We'll just call the ones that rhyme with "eat" eat words.  Feed some baby monsters their eat words to practice.  If you do well, reward yourself with an apple or a jelly bean.

As someone who has a child with sensory processing disorder, we often need to utilize different strategies to help calm down during a meltdown or in crowds. These are similar strategies Occupational Therapists use to help people with anxiety and sensory processing disorders. When helping our child with these strategies, we found that it also really helped adults as well.  These strategies help with anger episodes, anxiety, meltdowns, tension. Even if you do not have any of  diagnoses, this information can still be very helpful. Anytime any of these situations begin, just say "Alexa, open sensory avoider," and a helpful strategy will be provided to help calm down. Between our echo devices and echo auto, it makes using this skill helpful in many areas. skill_name: The Case of the Missing Canine
skill_description: "The Case of the Missing Canine" is the first story in The Doggie Investigation Gang, DIG™ series of children's books. The intended audience is second to fourth grade students. While learning third-grade level vocabulary, speaker dialogue and being introduced to chapter books, the reader follows three main dog characters, one of which is blind, as they solve mysteries in an effort to assist others. The three dogs are different breeds and have diverse skill sets. The series incorporates many hidden lessons, including the value of individual strengths and differences; the importance of teamwork; and the reward of caring for each other and assisting others in a time of need. All profits from sales of the first book will be donated to PAWS New England to assist in rescuing the dogs residing at Tipton County Animal Shelter, a high-kill shelter located in Tipton, TN. For more information on the DIG Series, visit the DIG website at digthebooks.com Credits: Shara Puglisi Katsos (Author), John Bulens (Illustrator), Karen Talbot (Illustrator), Chris Plankey (Developer)

Have you ever scratched your head when some one from a hindi community mentions a number when dealing with money? Have you asked what's the English version of the number mentioned in Hindi? Or do you have tough time negotiating prices while travelling in auto/cabs in North India  Whether you are in India or abroad, Novice or expert, it does not hurt to revise the hindi number system!!  Amaze your friends with your new found super power!! We have specifically recorded short audios for numbers from 0 to 100 with a short pause. The pause enables you to think of the number yourself before we reveal the hindi number. To master any number from 0 to 100., you can repeat them any number of times. The numbers in the 100's and 1000's follow similar pattern. Once you have gained mastery over 0 to 100 numbers it will be easy to master others Sample Utterances Invocation: 1. Alexa, Open Master Hindi Numbers After the welcome message You can say 2. Alexa, fifty five --- for having 55 in Hindi or  3 Alexa, get me 77 --- for having an audio of 77 in hindi with a short pause between the english and hindi version OR 4 Alexa, yes, for series of numbers from 0 to 100 with english and hindi versions for about 4 minutes Welcome to Master Hindi Numbers !! May you attain mastery!!

When it is time to write often times it is difficult to get your ideas flowing. Story Dice is a quick, fun way to give a spark to your story ideas. When prompted choose to roll the character, place, or item dice. Story Dice will give you a character, place or item to include in your story. You can stop there and start writing or continue to roll the dice for more ideas.

As someone who has a child with sensory processing disorder, we often need to utilize different strategies to help calm down during a meltdown or in crowds. These are similar strategies Occupational Therapists use to help people with anxiety and sensory processing disorders. When helping our child with these strategies, we found that it also really helped adults as well.  These strategies help with anger episodes, anxiety, meltdowns, tension. Even if you do not have any of  diagnoses, this information can still be very helpful. Anytime any of these situations begin, just say "Alexa, open calm down," and a helpful strategy will be provided to help calm down. Between our echo devices and echo auto, it makes using this skill helpful in many areas.

Select a number and Alexa will give you math operations and another number for the operation. This Alexa skill helps kids to start and master mental math abilities in a fun and interactive game. How to play: 1)   start by saying "start mathematics guru". 2)   The skills should reply with "Welcome to the mathematics guru. Start by saying a number" 3)   The user should speak a number after this. This number will be considered as one of the operands 4)   Alexa will announce another number along with an operand. 5)   The user is now supposed to perform the operation on the operands and announce the result to alexa. 6)    If the answer is correct, Alexa will say another number and another operand. 7)    The user gets 3 chances to find the correct answer. 8)    the user can say exit if he wants to quit.

Ballyland™ Flight is a fun, educational game for young children. The story takes them to the popular Ballyland, an imaginary world that is home to the Ballylanders, created by Sonokids®. This is where they will find Ballicopter, the little red helicopter, flying high through the skies, on his way to visit one of his friends. What will happen and how his adventure will develop, will be decided by the children! They are encouraged to use simple words to select twists in the story, developing voice control interaction with Alexa in a safe environment.  This game was created by experienced audio game developers and is particularly rich in audio. It uses a well-known voice for narration, includes two original songs that your children may want to move, sing, or dance along with, and offers great sound effects that will capture their imagination. Young children who are blind or visually impaired will also be able to enjoy and engage with this story, building self-confidence in the use of voice control technology.  “Every day is a Ballyland day, and a Ballyland day is a happy day!” The game helps to develop: • Simple voice commands to use smart speaker technology with voice control • Language skills • Choice Making skills • Concept of Cause & Effect • Concept of sequencing • Concepts such as nice/bad, slow/fast, grumpy/happy  • Singing and moving along to songs • Recognizing musical instruments and styles

Fast Facts is a fun way to practice mental math.  Just tell Alexa what grade level you want to play at (1st grade through 6th grade available today, more to come), and then choose multiplication, division, addition, or subtraction.  For each game, you'll have one minute to answer as many questions as you can.   Fast Fasts will track your results and let you know whenever you beat your high score for each grade and game mode. Examples: Alexa, Open Fast Facts and play first grade (Alexa will offer you game choices within that grade) Play fourth grade multiplication (Alexa will start the game immediately) Times Table Challenge (Alexa will ask you to select a number) Pre-Algebra Integers (Alexa will ask you to choose addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division)

With Tricky Words, kids can practice reading tricky/exception, and high frequency, words that they should learn and be able to recognize almost instantly in order to become the great little readers we want them to be!  For every 10 words read properly, you get a star. The stars you collect give you access to higher levels introducing new words. <!> NOTE: Because this skill is about reading, it is better suited for devices with a screen. If you don't have one, you can still play but you need to make sure you have a device with the Alexa app handy as the words will be shown on the app (on the 'Activity' page). <!> ⭐GAMEPLAY⭐ Simple! Alexa will show you a word on the device's screen or on your Alexa App ('Activity' section), and all you have to do is read the word back. Alexa will then tell you whether your answer is correct or not. You can have as many tries as you want to read the word. The most important is for you to try your best and practice! ⭐COMMANDS⭐ During the game, you can ask Alexa to: 1. WAIT, if you need more time to read the word. Alexa will play a hold music lasting 30 seconds. To interact with Alexa during that period, just say Alexa (or any other wake word if you changed your device's settings). 2. SKIP, if you really can't find the word and want to come back to it later. Alexa will ask you to repeat the word three times to memorize it. 3. tell you HOW MANY STARS you have, if you have been reading well and lost count of the number of stars you have collected. If you or you little one enjoy this game, please show your support by rating this skill and leaving a review. The objective is to make this game interesting enough for kids to be willing to practice reading all those words regularly, so if you have any suggestion to improve the game, or encounter any issue or bug while playing, please get in touch by emailing me at translationfd@gmail.com. LET'S GET READING!
