Does your toddler or preschooler know the alphabet?  Then they can probably start reading some three letter CVC (consonant vowel consonant)  words some "Letter Monsters" in a matter of weeks with a little bit of practice.   This skill is designed give parents another way to help very young learners gain fluency in reading words that have just three letters.  There are many reasons this early skill is important to developing reading.    There are about 200 CVC words you will want you early reader to know.  They probably recognize some you didn't even know they were familiar with.  Practicing is key and this skill is one of many tools you can use to keep the process of practicing rewarding and fun. Toddler's and preschoolers that know their phonics can read simple three letter words without knowing how to tell the difference between a vowel and a consonant.   But there are many good reasons but perhaps simplest is that virtually every word used in English has a vowel in it.   You may want to try to the Long Vowel Monster and Short Vowel Monster Alexa skills if your child hasn't had much exposure to the concept of vowels and consonants. As your young learner progresses in reading their ability to quickly decipher, or "sound out" more difficult words will improve how fast they can read and how accurately they can read.  This impacts reading comprehension and as a result the ability of your child to teach themselves as they get a little older.   Before most little children can read they've heard "Old McDonald had a farm, 'E', 'I', 'E', 'I', '0', many times.  Simply knowing that E, I and O are vowels can be helpful.  We hope this skill is also a helpful tool for you and your child find another way to make word sandwiches (consonants are the bread and a vowel is the meat) fun.

Want to practice adding to the number five using your hands, counting with your monster fingers and using your voice?  Then this skill is for you! Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress by adding numbers to five one at a a time by voice, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this skill is for you. Every child is unique, but they all have to learn some of the same things to succeed.  Number monster is a skill you can try yourself and, if it's something you think might fit with your child, you can personalize in the following ways:  Choose an incentive (prize) for your child         - One jelly bean         - An apple         - Using the iPad         - A lollipop          - Whatever else you want to offer! If you got something useful out the Monster Five, tell us in the review comments and, if you want, let us know what you would like changed to better fit your child (number of questions, specific questions, prizes, etc.).  We'll update the app for free and let you know when it's ready.  It's that easy!  Have fun and keep feeding those monsters correct number!  Yum!

If your toddler or preschooler has learned to count to ten, congratulations!  Those number skills will help them to read and spell also.  But when using numbers to describe letters, you are often more concern with the position (ordinal values) of the letter than cardinal values (quantity).  You might ask your child, "what's the first letter?", or "what's the second letter?"   In these situations, the value of knowing 1st, 2nd, 3rd and so forth to reading efforts becomes clear. Fortunately, there are many fun ways to get your young learner to voluntarily explore ordinal values while learning other important things about the world they live in.  Learning about the planets is one way to do this. Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress by adding numbers to five one at a a time by voice, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers. Does your toddler or preschooler know the alphabet?  Then they can probably teach short vowels to some "Letter Monsters" in a matter of weeks with a little bit of practice.   This skill is designed give parents another way to help very young learners identify long vowels. Toddler's and preschoolers that know their phonics can read simple three letter words without knowing how to tell the difference between a vowel and a consonant.  So why should your child get to know their vowels as soon as possible?  There are many good reasons but perhaps simplest is that virtually every word used in English has a vowel in it.   As your young learner progresses in reading their ability to quickly decipher, or "sound out" more difficult words will impact how quickly and accurately they can read.  This impacts reading comprehension and as a result the ability of your child to teach themselves as they get a little older.   Before most young children can read they've heard "Old McDonald had a farm, 'E', 'I', 'E', 'I', '0', many times.  Simply knowing that E, I and O are vowels can be helpful.  We hope this skill is also a helpful tool for you and your child to find another way to make learning short vowels fun.

Have fun practicing multiplication and division with math loving sidekick Ginger the Math Cat! Earn star points and embark on the journey to become next math Ninja Master! Check all that apply: ⭐️ Have you just started practicing your first multiplications and divisions? ⭐️ Are you looking for help memorizing those pesky times tables? ⭐️ Were you ever wondering if cats would be good practice partners? ⭐️ Did you possibly consider against all well meant advice to pursue career of Ninja Master? ⭐️ Do you excessively overuse emoji whenever you can? And, could all of this be a little fun too, please? You might have just arrived! For grown-ups: Ginger Math helps your child memorize 2nd and 3rd grade times tables using simple daily multiplication routine. Designed with accessibility in mind, Ginger Math lets your child easily replay preset practice terms on their own. Choose multiplication or division, number of questions and one of four increasingly challenging difficulty levels. • Easy, factors from 0 to 4. • Medium, factors from 2 to 6. • Advanced, factors from 3 to 8. • Hard, factors from 4 to 12. Ginger Math adjusts to your child's progress emphasizing repetition where necessary. Conversely, with increasing proficiency, reduces verbosity and provides your child with opportunity to redo missed answers. Skill attempts to engage with funny voice interactions, visual appeal, practice score keeping and long term goal with easy to understand progress summary. If your practitioner is visual learner and you do not have Echo device with the screen, have your child practice using the Alexa app on the tablet or phone first. Invocation phrases: • Have Ginger Math help you start new or replay usual practice: “Alexa, open Ginger Math”. • Ask Ginger Math for particular times or division table: “Alexa, ask Ginger Math for times table”. • Have Ginger Math summarize practice progress: “Alexa, ask Ginger Math about results”. In-skill invocation phrases: • Ask Ginger Math for more time to answer the question: “I need more time” or “Wait”. • Tell Ginger Math to repeat the question: “Say that again” or “Repeat”. • Have Ginger Math help with the answer: “I don't know” or “Tell me”. • Ask Ginger Math to start new or restart usual round: “Start new practice” or “Play usual round”. Let us know what you think, good, bad, we take 'em all. Or just feel like leaving us friendly note? Drop us a line at hello.gingermath@gmail.com and we will get back to you as soon we finish our daily practice!

Want to practice adding the number two using your hands, counting with your monster fingers and using your voice?  Then this skill is for you! Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this skill is for you. skill_name: Wheels on the Bus - Indian Version
skill_description: Famous Wheels on the bus rhyme for kids.  The wheels on the bus go round and round Round and round Round and round The wheels on the bus go round and round All through the town The wipers on the bus go Swish, swish, swish Swish, swish, swish Swish, swish, swish The wipers on the bus go Swish, swish, swish All through the town The horn on the bus goes Beep, beep, beep Beep, beep, beep Beep, beep, beep The horn on the bus goes Beep, beep, beep All through the town The doors on the bus go open and shut Open and shut Open and shut The doors on the bus go open and shut All through the town The Driver on the bus says "Move on back Move on back, move on back" The Driver on the bus says "Move on back" All through the town The babies on the bus says "Wah, wah, wah Wah, wah, wah Wah, wah, wah" The babies on the bus says "Wah, wah, wah" All through the town The mommies on the bus says "Shush, shush, shush Shush, shush, shush Shush, shush, shush" The mommies on the bus says "Shush, shush, shush" All through the town Session 1: User: Alexa, open wheels on the bus Alexa: Starting Wheels on the Bus - You can say, start or begin, to begin. User: Begin Alexa: Wheels on the Bus <Alexa completes the song on user interruption> User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open wheels on the bus Alexa: You were listening to wheels on the bus, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the start and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to The Wheels on the Bus. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to The Wheels on the Bus. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume.

skill_name: Story Starter by selfStarter VOICE EDUCATION
skill_description: Help your child become a self starter! Just teach them to say, "Alexa, open Story Starter" then say "Student," and Alexa will give them a daily writing prompt. Educational exercises initiated by students can help them become independent learners, while at the same time, developing confidence in their ability to finish assignments.   After your child writes their response to the writing prompt, have them give it to you, and at your own leisure say, "Alexa, open Story Starter." Choose the "Teacher" option, and Alexa will read the teacher's guide for the daily writing prompt so you can review your student's work.  If you have a pre-writer, have them dictate their answer to you, and use some or all of what you wrote down as an opportunity for them to do copy work. Dictation and copy work exercises will build reading, writing, and grammar skills. This is the first Skill by selfStarter: VOICE EDUCATION. Go to https://selfstarter.io for more info about how to use this Skill, and for tips on how you can help your child become a self starter!

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. How fast can you climb the mountain? Just ask Alexa!  Introducing “Mountain” by Audiolex LLC. Mountain is one of the most well-known dice games, now transformed for you to enjoy through Alexa.  Mountain is a simple arithmetic game for kids all ages. The mountain game can be played directly against Alexa or Alexa can take on the role of the scorekeeper and overseer. Beyond enjoying our game, parents have the option to gain access to our progress-tracking dashboard.  Through this dashboard, parents can monitor their child’s speech & language development over each successive game in accordance to the ASHA Guidelines*.  *ASHA is the American Speech-Hearing-Language Association. More information can be found at https://www.asha.org/about/    ** Make sure ‘Kid Skill Purchasing’ is enabled in your Alexa App to play the full game **  RULES BELOW  ——————————————————————————————————————————— Age: All-ages  Number of players: 1 - 4 (including Alexa)  Equipment: 2 dice (optional)  The object of the game is to be the first to climb your mountain, in number order, and then descend the other side. Youngest player goes first.  First player rolls the dice and hopes for a 1, which will allow them to reach the first step in their mountain. They must ascend in numerical order, so they cannot cross off the 2 until they have crossed off the 1. If they roll a 1 and a 2, however, they can cross ascend both steps in one turn. The player continues rolling dice until they roll numbers that do not match the next step(s) on their mountain. The turn is then passed to the next player. Play continues until someone has made it all the way up their mountain and down the other side in the correct order. You may choose to roll your own, physical dice or have Alexa roll virtual dice for you. If personal dice are rolled, each player has to announce the numbers they’ve rolled in order to climb the mountain or move onto the next player. If Alexa rolls the virtual dice, she will announce the numbers that have been rolled. However, the player still has to repeat the roll outcome in order to continue playing the game.  Alexa may participate as one of the active players or simply maintain score and order of the game.  ——————————————————————————————————————————————————— Mountain skill is suitable for kids and will require verified parental consent if not granted earlier for another kid skill. PLEASE NOTE: If you have issues, questions or comments please email us at info@audiolex.org. We want to hear directly from you! ADDITIONAL NOTE: Disabling the skill will erase all previous player data on the game. DISCLAIMER: The data contained in the progress-tracking dashboard, including the text, images, and graphics, are for informational purposes only. Use of the dashboard is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical judgment and you should promptly contact your own health care provider regarding any medical conditions or medical questions that you have. THE DASHBOARD DOES NOT OFFER MEDICAL ADVICE, AND NOTHING CONTAINED IN THE CONTENT IS INTENDED TO CONSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL ADVICE FOR MEDICAL DIAGNOSIS OR TREATMENT. © 2019 AUDIOLEX LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

Smart Kids is targeted to anyone that want to learn from topics in Geography, Culture, Animals and Space. Topics and questions will be updated over time. The quiz is setup to provide a user with a random question after the user provides a category. After 10 questions are answered a final score is given. The goal is to try and improve every day, by trying Smart Kids on many categories over time. We will be loading new questions and new categories frequently, and eventually opening a leaderboard and targeted goals to further educational learning in a fun way. With Thinking Cap Math your child can practice K-4 math skills in an exciting new way, and achieve significant results! Join Coach Fred and other members of the math team to help win the Thinking Cap Math Championship. Have fun drilling math concepts and solve hilarious word problems as you move up the Championship League Ladder, from Very Speedy Amoebas through Courageous Chickens, and even -- whooooooo would have thought it -- all the way to the Funky Owls. As kids play, they master fundamental math skills including addition, subtraction, skip counting and multiplication. And with a supply of thousands, there are new questions and stories every time you play. INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE: To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open Thinking Cap”. To repeat the question, say "Repeat" If you would like a few seconds to think over the problem, just say "Let me think." SPECIAL NOTE TO AUDIENCES WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES: The Thinking Cap Math team works closely with teachers and students with learning disabilities and visual impairments to make the program especially effective for these audiences. Our skill is exceptionally useful for students of all types who face challenges with reading and writing, and can enable them to achieve high levels of math literacy.

skill_name: Quirky Count with variable interval upto 3 seconds
skill_description: How Many Times you wanted alexa to count upto ten with a certain interval in mind? By default alexa counts without any breaks! Let's say you wanted to practice deep breaths for count of 10 with pause of 1 second. With Quirky count you can do exactly this and much more. In this skill one can ask Alexa to count from one number to another number. For example you can say count number from 3 to 30. Or count upto ten. We currently support 4 modes 1. No delay --- Can be invoked by simply asking quirky count to count upto a certain number 2. 1 second --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 1 or 1 second 3. 2 second  --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 2 or 2 second 4. 3 second  --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 3 or 3 second Sample Utterances: 1. Count from 2 to 10 with interval of 1 second 2. Count to 5 with interval of 1 second 3. Count number from 2 to 10 You can reach out to me on tathagata [at] tathagatamitra [dot] com for any feedback

The Letter Game is designed to help parents teach early literacy skills in a safe, natural, and engaging way! The Letter Game works on three important early literacy skills (3 levels per literacy skill and 10 questions per level) as follows: - Letter names (identify the names of letters) - Letter sounds (identify the sounds of letters) - Letter blends (identify combination of letters that make a sound) To skip ahead: - Start Over  -Say, “New Game” - New Game - Say, “Letter Names” or “Letter Sounds” or “Letter Blends” - New Level - Say, “Next Level” or “Previous Level” By combining voice technology and real-world, tangible play, SayKid helps families learn together in a safe, natural, and engaging way. Search "SayKid" on the Alexa Skill store for additional learning experiences.  If you found the skill helpful, we greatly appreciate reviews! Awards - SayKid wins Grand Prize in the 2020 Alexa EdTech Competition  - Harvard names SayKid a Finalist in the Saul Zaentz Early Education Competition - SayKid wins MN Cup "Moonshot" Prize at US Bank Stadium

This is a Mighty Calculator app for Alexa.  Currently supports addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Can also handle complex decimal calculations.   Sample Utterances:  - For Addition - What's five-point nine plus three.  - For Subtraction - What is five-point nine minus three.  - For Multiplication - What is five-point nine multiplied by three.  - For Division - What's five-point nine divided by three. This is being developed for middle school kids like me in mind.  Link to my Git Hub page where you can get source code: https://github.com/joelmanjet/my-calculator-py Explanation of the code is on my YouTube channel where I do educational videos: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSt9bIi3GKhuTw7n1WaYz8Q

This is an educational skill that presents interesting facts about the deep sea through the eyes of Drippy Dip - a friendly and fun deep sea creature who has come to the surface to tell us about the place she is from. She uses simple language to describe fascinating facts about deep sea exploration, some history - and mainly, the wonderful creatures that live there. The skill has a number of facts that are presented one after the other in a random order, as long as the user continues to ask for more. The information will be refreshed periodically - so please do come back for new facts.  This skill is for curious kids of all ages - who we hope can learn something new about the mysterious deep sea.

Discover the Elements is a mind-expanding exploration of the periodic table of the elements, aimed at young people studying science in school, and anyone with a general interest in science. As you explore, you will collect sets of elements, building your own periodic table. This skill is based on the internationally best-selling book and award winning app The Elements, by Theodore Gray, Popular Science Magazine’s Gray Matter columnist. The elements are what we, and everything around us, are made of.  You will discover fascinating facts, figures, and stories of the elements – there’s a lot more to the periodic table than a bunch of numbers and letters!  The quiz sections of this skill are intentionally challenging. So we recomend taking notes while you listen and interact.   FEATURES: - Detailed and current information from Wolfram|Alpha - Fun stories and fascinating facts - Engaging introduction and on-boarding for new users  HELPFUL HINTS: - If you need help at any point in the skill just say "help!" - Wondering how you're doing? say "status update" or "how am I doing?" Keep an eye out for updates as we add new sets to collect!

The Wizcart platform began as a pure self-scanning application and grew over time in response to the needs of merchants and customers. Now it includes a variety of capabilities designed to allow different retail formats to fully digitize their customer interactions. The core platform involves an application for shoppers and a separate application for staff that mediates shopping, customer service, and promotions. The shopper application comes in two flavors: Universal, for use by multiple smaller retailers, and Private White-label, for larger brands. Additional capabilities include product marketing, order-ahead counter service, and a special loss prevention system that is more secure than a standard checkout lane​.

The Stolen Stars of Matariki is a bilingual (English and Māori) illustrated story with engaging voice recordings, sound effects, music and illustrations. Synopsis: Sam and Te Rerehua, visiting Grandma and Pōua at Te Mata Hāpuku (Birdling’s Flat). While collecting agate and fishing for eels from the beach they look up at the stars and their grandmother tells them stories. One night Grandma notices two Matariki stars are missing from the sky. They then discover some naughty patupaiarehe playing on the beach with two glowing rocks. It’s up to Sam and Te Rerehua to save the stars. The two fair-headed children blend in with the patupaiarehe on the beach and ask what is happening.  The patupaiarehe spend so much time skiting about what they’re going to do with the two stolen stars they don’t notice it’s nearly sunrise. When Te Rerehua tells them the sun is coming up, the patupaiarehe run from the beach, fearing their delicate white skins will burn.Pōua launches the two Matariki stars back up into the sky with his eeling gaff, and the nine stars of Matariki are back together again. The grandparents and children then carry their freshly caught eels home. About the Book’s Creators: Miriama Kamo is an award-winning journalist. She is the anchor of TVNZ’s flagship current affairs programme Sunday and Māori current affairs programme Marae. Miriama has worked on many of TVNZ’s key programmes including 1 News at 6 as a newsreader. She is also a keen writer who is published in Metro, NZ Herald and The Spinoff and is currently trying her hand at writing a screenplay. Miriama and husband Mike are proud parents of Sam and Te Rerehua. This is her first book with Scholastic NZ.Zak Waipara is a former NZ Herald graphic artist and HOD of Animation at Animation College.   Zak Waipara (Rongowhakaata, Ngati Porou, Ngati Ruapani, Ngati Kahungunu) is now Digital Media lecturer at AUT. He has worked as a designer for Māori Television’s children’s show Miharo, illustrated comics and a range of books, and created animated music videos. He is the illustrator of Horeta and the Waka (Scholastic NZ). Born in Milton, in the South Island, Zak now lives in Auckland. About the Scholastic: Scholastic is the world’s largest children’s book publisher and Scholastic New Zealand has been bringing the best in children’s books to Kiwi kids, Kiwi families and Kiwi schools throughout New Zealand for more than 50 years. With LUCKY Book Club and Book Fairs, Scholastic helps Kiwi kids learn to love books and reading, and works with New Zealand teachers to help build a culture of literacy at their school. For more information visit www.scholastic.co.nz. This project was funded by Perpetual Guardian Foundation from the Shifted Perspectives fund.

skill_name: Ask My Kid - Remote Learning Activities
skill_description: Designed to help students and kids learn and study at home. Teachers and parents love having the extra support during busy days and evenings with AskMyKid. Whether kids are distance and remote learning or after a full day at school, kids often struggle to focus on study and homework. To support, AskMyKid has brain breaks, timers, academic practice, and emotional support activities. Teachers and parents can instantly add their own activities too. To learn how visit and see the full list of commands, go to:  https://askmykid.com/activities For example: - Need to get students to refocus for homework? Say “Alexa, calm down with my kid" or "Alexa, ask my kid to calm down" - Need to get their wiggles out? “Alexa, dance with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid to dance" - Want to build their attention muscle? “Alexa, mindfulness with my kid” or " Alexa, ask my kid for mindfulness" - Want a timer? “Alexa, 2-minute music countdown with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid for a 2-minute music countdown" - How about calm music during work time? “Alexa, background music with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid for background music" Either start the command with "ask my kid" or end with "with my kid". Learn more: At AskMyClass, we believe in making education more empowering and engaging, using affordable tools, so every child learns better. Voice technology and AI are skills that all kids will be interacting with when they enter the workforce in 10 years, and we’re keen on getting them ready for that future. •Summary Highlights Storybooks from Bamboo boosts kids’ reading and listening comprehension through interactive Highlights professionally narrated stories. Highlights’ unique approach to “Fun with a Purpose” helps engage children through entertaining stories, while also promoting skills that help lead to success in school – and beyond!  •Basic Use (How it works) Children and parents can start the skill by asking Alexa to “Open Highlights Storybooks.” They then can select a reading exercise level and story. A friendly narrator begins reading selections from the storybook. After each narration, children are asked questions about the story, which they can verbally answer. Alexa identifies whether the answer is correct or incorrect.  Navigation tips: Say “Alexa, open Highlights Storybooks” to open skill Say “Level 1”, “Level 2”, or “Level 3” to change difficulty Say “Switch Books” to change story Say “Give me a Hint” to get a hint Say “Alexa, stop” to exit •Story Titles (content available)  Level 1: Enjoy the Show, Bea and Lop, Pigs in My Garden, Davy Duck's Grumpy Day Level 2: Lulu Builds a Choo-Choo, Little Bunny Celebrates Spring, The Lucky Penny, Time for a Party Level 3: Robin's Best Nest, Balto the Sled Dog, In the Rain Forest, The Skeleton Crew MORE levels and stories to come!  •Development evidence  How will this help my child?  -Fosters reading skills for both readers and pre-readers to expand vocabulary, hone grammar and better prepare for tests  -Sparks interest and imagination with audio stories, a new and different way of learning -Increases engagement and independence with child-friendly content and interface Why is this fun for kids?  -Professionally voiced storytelling conveys depth and emotion, engaging children in multisensory experiences and brings reading to life.  -Multiple genres allow kids to choose stories that appeal to them, building a passion for reading.  -Wide variety of stories, themes and reading levels encourage hours of engagement and learning! •Bamboo Grove (Optional Parent Portal) & Account Linking Registration on Bamboo Grove provides results about how children are progressing, so parents can understand their strengths and areas for development & view badges awarded. Parents can register for a FREE Bamboo Learning account on Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com.  After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents need to link that account with the Highlights Storybooks Alexa skill by opening the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then search for Highlights Storybooks within the skills section of the Alexa App.  After finding Highlights Storybooks in the Alexa App, select “Settings”, and then “Link Account”.  A Bamboo Learning screen will appear.  Sign in to the Bamboo Learning account and Highlights Storybook will be linked.  Then visit Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com to view progress. •About Highlights / Bamboo Highlights is a beloved global media brand dedicated to inspiring children to become Curious, Creative, Caring and Confident individuals. Through print and digital content that encourages thinking, creativity, self-expression and respect, Highlights helps kids build literacy, and other school and life skills, all while having fun. Highlights’ magazines, book clubs, apps, activity packs and more bring kids “Fun with a Purpose,” anytime, anywhere. To learn more and to connect with Highlights, visit Highlights.com. Bamboo Learning is an education-focused software and services company with a mission to become the leader in voice-first education applications and content. Bamboo Learning is focused on developing skills for Alexa that enable children and adults to have fun learning and practicing different subjects while listening, viewing pictures, and using their voice. Learn more at BambooLearning.com. Copyright © 2019 Highlights. All rights reserved. For personal use only. To learn about Highlights™, please visit Highlights.com.

I am a dad of two boys who, unfortunately, like to wake up early in the morning! If you are reading this, chances are you are in the same boat. Well I have good news for you, this skill is here to help. Ever since I had my kids use this skill in the morning, my amount of sleep in the morning has gone up significantly, my kids like me more (sort of), and my marriage has never been better. I even got promoted at work, so seems like a no brainer. Here is how to use it. The first time you open the skill, it will ask you to set the time that your kids can wake up. Tell it a time and that's it! Now tell your kids in the morning to first say 'Alexa, can I wake up?', if it's not time yet, Alexa will tell them to wait in their bed a bit longer. Once its past the wake up time, then they can get up, and probably run into your room and make sure you are awake to. For this skill to work, the time zone of the device that you use to setup your wake up time has to be correct. If you are having issues with the wake up time being wrong, go into your Alexa App and update the time zone for your device. Re-set the wake up time by saying 'Alexa, ask Can I Wake Up for settings', re-set your wake up time and you should be good to go! Now get out there and get some sleep!

skill_name: Third Grade Kids Daily Math Practice by AskMyClass
skill_description: Designed to help third graders (students and kids aged between 7 and 9) practice their math everyday.  So easy to use: * 10 multiple-choice math problems that are aligned to common core topics for 3rd grade.  * Problems are delivered from a large random bank and goes beyond simple arithmetic (like addition, subtraction, or multiplication). * Most are spoken problems, so they require listening, thinking, and then selecting one of the choices. You might want keep a paper or pencil handy for writing down the questions. How to answer a question: * At the prompt, say the correct number of the multiple choices given. Your answer will be checked to see if it is right or wrong. With the correct answer given. * Say "repeat" to hear the question again. * Say "more time" instead of answering the question to get additional thinking time. Don’t forget, most parents set a daily reminder “Alexa, remind me to ask third grade at 5pm”. We want to encourage kids to love math and be open to making mistakes and trying again. More info: AskMyClass is used by thousands of educators everyday, and is recommended by teachers to reduce learning loss over the summer. At AskMyClass, we believe in making education more empowering and engaging, using affordable tools that are screen-free, so every child learns better. Voice technology and AI are skills that all kids will be interacting with when they enter the workforce in 10 years, and we’re keen on getting them ready for that future. skill_name: Kiddo ABC - Alphabet and Words Learning Skill
skill_description: Kiddo ABC is a fun based alphabet learning and vocabulary building skill for small children. The game teaches the new words to kids in increasing order of complexity i.e. starting with simpler words. Game is adaptive in nature i.e. it remembers the words that kids have already used during the game; using that memory game encourages the kids to learn new words instead of repeating the same old word again and again. Also in learn mode game ensures that kids are taught new words instead of the words that they have already used. Skill will start by using any of the following phrases 'Alexa, start abc' 'Alexa, open abc' 'Alexa, launch abc' Skill will then give option to the user to - Learn All letters by saying 'LEARN' or 'LEARN ALL' - Learn individual letters by saying LEARN followed by any letter, as an example 'LEARN D', 'LEARN T' or 'LEARN A' or any valid combination   - Play with letters and words by saying 'PLAY'.  kids can use these options one after the other, as many times as they want. In LEARN ALL mode Alexa will speak out words for all English alphabets one by one starting from A to Z. When learning specific letter Alexa will speak words for only that Letter. Alexa remembers the words that child has already used in PLAY mode, those words are not repeated in the learn mode again, hence allowing for more learning & vocabulary building for kids.  In Play mode, Alexa will ask word for English alphabets, by prompting 'A For'. Kids are supposed to respond with any of the common English words starting with letter A. If word is found to be incorrect, skill will prompt user for one more try. Also if child repeats the same word more than twice that may not be allowed. If word is found to be correct. Skill will continue and ask for next letter i.e. 'B For' and likewise the game will continue and will end with letter 'Z' once the kid has responded correctly with words for all English alphabets.  Alexa will help on its own in case kid gives incorrect responses twice for the same letter. Also kids can take help any moment by saying 'HELP' to Alexa, then Alexa will help back by speaking words for that letter. Once kid has completed all letters, Alexa will revise all letters where either there were mistakes or where help was given. In Play mode, game has a PAUSE feature, so at any letter kids can simply say 'PAUSE', the game will record the letter where child was and next time if the game is restarted within two hours it will resume from that letter instead of starting from A again.  Likewise in Play mode, if child misses to respond to skill's prompts and game stops. In this case also, game will record the letter where child was and next time if the game is restarted within two hours it will resume from that letter instead of starting from A again.  The word list that skill uses contains only the common words as per primary standard. This list is very rich and is continuously updated. In case more complex words are spoken the skill will recognize them. But when in learn mode the skill will only teach the words from its own list, these words are more suitable for small children. Also game arranges its list in increasing order of complexity, so simpler words are taught first followed by difficult ones. Best of Luck Kid! Good fun and great learning to you!

The world celebrates as scientists push the boundaries of nature by reviving a date palm tree that has been extinct for thousands of years.  Unfortunately, sometimes when you push nature…nature pushes back! Billie Smith is a typical eleven-year-old girl who loves stories about mummies, ancient Egypt and the mysteries of that region.  At the same time, she’s also still a little afraid of the dark. Her father is a botanist who has been in Israel helping revive seeds found in King Herod’s tomb and trying to grow them again.  Amazingly, he finds success and the Judean Date Palm is now on a world tour like a rock star.  All that means to Billie is that her father is finally coming home. The gift that her father brings her…three ancient seeds that are duds, will change the course of her life forever.  On the other side of the planet, Portrand is angry.  He has been asleep for two thousand years when the familiar scent of pollen awakens him.  This proud dragon, who ruled the skies for hundreds of years, is suddenly thrown into a world where he no longer knows the rules.  He’s scared, hungry and currently on a collision course with Billie’s young family. What happens when you meet a creature from your worst nightmares?  This ‘dragon out of water’ tale is a story of understanding, friendship and eighteen thousand pounds of fantasy. Bedtime will never be the same... Imagine reading a story where your child's reading triggers cool audio effects that bring the whole story to life! This is a completely immersive adventure for young readers! Story Theater is an exciting new system that makes you part of the adventure.  You'll read along, read aloud and eagerly anticipate the next turn of the page. You can try the system for free.  Just say "Alexa, play Dragonpalm." When the narrator says, "It's your turn to read," just say "Next".  You'll instantly become part of an exciting serial adventure tale that will make everyone eager to see what happens next. If you enjoy the experience, you can explore the entire system by purchasing the companion illustrated book here on Amazon or at immersive-publishing.com. All of the Story theater stories from https://immersive-publishing.com are family friendly and designed for kids.  If your child loves to read, this just enhances the experience by adding sound effects, a narrator, interactive reading, music and ambient backgrounds.  But if your child views reading as a chore, this might just be the factor that gets them excited about reading.  The stories are exciting and fun...any kid should love them.  Also...the stories are interesting enough that parents should enjoy them too!   You can try the first few chapters for free and if you like it...you can purchase the whole book and more like them at our web site.   We hope you enjoy the show!  Parents:  Story Theater is designed for kids.  We make it so that your child develops a lifelong love of reading.  The system moves forward using prompts read by your child which trigger narration, sound effects, music, background sounds...even Alexa herself in an age appropriate exciting adventure.  Don't worry...once you start listening, we think you'll enjoy the ride as well.

skill_name: Brain Master - Multi Device Brain Facts and Fun
skill_description: Lots of fun for the whole family. Brain Master is a multi device skill, playable on any type of Amazon device. With or without a screen. You can choose from 9 categories of facts, education, and fun such as; * Brain Boost - Fun advice on activities to help boost your brain. * Brain Fun - Advice on activities that will help you enjoy your brain  * Brain Laughs - Brain Jokes * Brain Dimensions - Facts about the 5 main parts of your brain * Brain Loving - A Brain hug a day, keeps the doctor away. Brain loving helps lift you up when your feeling down * Mind Blown - Facts to blow your mind * Brain Nap - Facts about sleeping and your brain * Brain Cooldown - A little help to blow off some steam * Brain Health - Facts about nutritional foods that give you super brain powers ** Featuring a sliding interchanging screen for Alexa Display devices and little hints to help you decide what to do next! Just follow the prompts during the skill, Alexa will be with you the whole time to tell you what you can do and to give you advice on what to do next and how to navigate around, relax, have a go and most of all, have fun! The Information in this skill is for informational and educational purposed only. ** You can say; TO START THE GAME: * "Alexa, open Brain Master" * "Alexa, start Brain Master" * "Alexa, launch Brain Master" ALTERNATIVELY TO START THE CATEGORIES DIRECTLY: * "Alexa, ask Brain Master to start Brain Dimensions" (or any of the Categories) * "Alexa, ask Brain Master to start Main Menu" ***** IF YOU LOVE THIS SKILL. PLEASE BE KIND AND RATE US 5 STARS. THANK YOU.***** Thank you for choosing Brain Master and we really hope you enjoy this skill. If you have any advice or feedback for making this skill better, please contact sargef38@bigpond.com.  You can also check out our other skills such as; * Hypnotize Me * Whale Symphony * Hearts Desire * Take Me Flying * Dream Achiever * Just Chilling * Yoga Me * Majesty Words * Out of this World

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Ever wanted to learn every country in the world? Stamp My Passport makes it easy. The skill features a simple learning platform; just choose one continent to learn at a time.  Along your journey, you'll also pick up on the capitals and languages spoken in each country. Once you guess a country right without any help, you get that country stamped onto your passport. When you return to the skill, you may choose a continent and say "review". You'll be able to review only the countries you've stamped from that continent. Other features include: - Ask to show the location of a country. "Show me Libya" - Create unique passports for each user in the household. "Create a passport" - Delete passports. "Delete a passport"  - Pick a continent. "North America" - Pick a mode. "Learn" to learn, "Review" to review stamped countries - Pick both a mode and a continent. "Learn/Review North America" - Ask for help on the game rules. "Help" - Personalized Amazon Polly voices for each continent The skill is multimodal, as it shows images of the countries. It should work fine on the Echo Show and Spot, and Fire TV. To use the skill on a voice-only device such as an Echo or Echo Dot, please click on the 'Activity' tab of the Home page on the Alexa app, or go to alexa.amazon.com. Then you will be able to view questions and maps of countries.

Alexa can help you learn new topics or study for your test. You can review the flash cards and then test your knowledge. At any point you can say "Alexa, review mode" to switch to review or say "Alexa, test mode" to start a test. You can say "Alexa, next" to move to the next card. At any point during the test, you can say "Alexa, what's my score" to get your current test score. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint.  Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Rapid Math is a multi-modal skill helps users practice addition, subtraction and multiplication math problems. Users earn points by answering questions correctly on the first try. Rapid Math keeps track of high scores, allows users to review incorrect answers and provides a summary of the user's performance. Rapid Math offers multiple skill levels that will challenge users of all ages.  For users with a screen, Rapid Math displays each math problem along with the current score, the user's high score and the medals the user has earned. For users without a screen, Alexa provides options for navigating the skill throughout play.  To launch the skill, say, "Alexa, open Rapid Math."  Once Rapid Math has been launched, say, "Alexa, play a game." The skill will prompt the user for the desired difficultly level, easy, medium, hard or expert. The skill also allows users to directly launch into a game by saying, "Alexa, ask Rapid Math to start an easy game."  Rapid Math keeps track of any math problems the user answered incorrectly. At any time the user can review these problems by saying, "Alexa, review the problems I missed." Users can also review a summary of their performance including the number of problems attempted, problems answered correctly and percentage of correct problems in each problem category, addition, multiplication and subtraction. To review a summary of game performance, say, "Alexa, show the score."

How many American cities can you name? Alexa quizzes you on items in a category that start with a certain letter. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

"Teach me Tables" helps kids learn and memorize math tables in a new, interactive, visually appealing and fun way.  It starts out by asking which table kids like to learn. It then displays and recites the first five items from that table. It will ask the user to memorize them and once they are ready, it tests their memory with a short quiz. It congratulates kids using funny voices when they get it right, and when they get it wrong, it makes funny sounds and tells them the correct answer. For every correct answer, it assigns 10 points and the score is tracked through out the session to keep kids engaged. Once the first half of the table is completed, it then goes on to teach  the rest of the table using similar techniques.  This skill is developed based on a real life, proven teaching techniques used to teach kids master their math times tables.

With this game the children will be able to study and learn the times tables, in a funny way, having this skill as their particular teacher !. The game has two modes: in the first, children can score points by answering challenges, or they can also ask it to help them study a specific times table.

As a parent myself, I understand that nothing is more important than the well being of your children.  Everyday, kids are bombarded with messages that are detrimental to their happiness, confidence and self esteem. I built this simple skill for my son to ensure that he starts every day feeling confident, happy, calm and ready to have the best day he can. Try it for a while with your kids too and watch as their confidence, self esteem and happiness grows. This skill itself is very simple. The idea behind it is very powerful. Kids repeat 6 randomly chosen, positive affirmations about themselves. It takes about one minute to complete. Positive affirmations have an extraordinary effect on children - They help to inspire, motivate, and build confidence and self-esteem. When kids use positive affirmations from an early age they'll reap a lifetime of benefits. A really great way to start or end their day! This skill never collects any personal data. If you have suggestions to improve the skill, please let me know in the comments. Thanks and have a great day!

Numbers Trivia uses the famous "numbersapi" API for getting facts related to numbers and dates and presents it to Alexa users in an elegant fashion. It is a multimodal skill and has both voice and visual aspect through which user can interact with their Alexa device using this skill. This is a great skill that helps the young bright minds to learn numbers and stories about dates in a beautiful and interactive manner. Just give the skill a test run and you will fall in love with it. Numbersapi is an elegant API designed to bring meaning to your metrics and stories to your dates. This skill uses this free API to provide the users those great interesting facts about the numbers they use in their daily life. Here are some of the commands to help you get started: 1) "Alexa, open Numbers Trivia" "Welcome to the Numbers Trivia skill! I can give you many interesting facts about the numbers, their significance in the world of mathematics. I can also tell all the great historical facts any date is known for." 2) "Help!" "You can ask me questions like, 'Give me a fact about number 42'; 'What is significance of 42 in mathematics?'; 'What is special about 5th September?'" 3) "What is special about 5th September?" "September 5th is the day in 1927 that the first Oswald the Lucky Rabbit cartoon, Trolley Troubles, produced by Walt Disney, is released by Universal Pictures." 4) "Give me a fact about number 42" "42 is the answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything." 5) "Tell me a fact about any random number" "145 is the atomic number of Unquadpentium." 6) "What is the significance of 100 in mathematics?" "100 is the smallest number whose common logarithm is a prime number." 7) "Tell me the importance of today" "January 1st is the day in 1860 that First Polish stamp is issued."

Job Explorer provides an interactive exploration environment for children learning about the different professions in the world.  It has launched with four professions, they are:    - astronaut   - doctor   - musician   - Australian tour guide Each profession is championed by a fictional character with a distinctly synthesized voice to help immerse you into the world of that job.  You can learn about the personal story of the character, get facts about the job, learn about related jobs and complete badges.  There are four badges per job focusing on core elements of the job. To earn a badge, the user needs to answer five questions correctly.  The questions keep rotating through the non-answered ones until they are all complete. Badge progress is saved so the you can complete the badges over whatever period of time you like. Please direct feedback and questions to steven.bowden@protonmail.com otherwise you can leave feedback in the Alexa Skill Store which is always appreciated. Privacy Information This skill stores the user progress throughout job badges and job facts to enable continuation of game-play across multiple sessions. No personal information is collected. Data collected by the skill is not shared with any third party and only used for improving the skill performance.

Science Studio wants to make science fun and engaging for kids. For kids, counting is the first step of their mathematical journey. It usually starts with reciting the number sequence (one, two, three, etc.). Then the boundaries are getting extended (counting to ten, twenty). Soon, the kids start changing the counting direction (counting backwards), or skipping numbers using a specific interval. "Let's Count" is an Alexa skill that will help children (and adults) practice their counting. The user is supposed to define the upper and lower bound for the counting (these bounds are inclusive), the counting direction (forward or backwards) and the counting step (counting interval). The skill will do the rest. In case of invalid parameters, the skill will notify the user that the counting is not possible. Enjoy counting with "Let's Count" Alexa skill.

Stars have a life cycle. As they age, they grow larger and eventually collapse under their own gravity. When massive stars collapse, they do so in a fiery explosion making them a supernova. As the mass that was held by them disperses, what remains is a small ball of mass. It is of the size of a city, but is extremely dense. In fact, neutron stars are one of the most dense objects. The gravitational pressure makes protons and electrons to become neutrons and make up for most of its density. A star rotates about its axis. When it goes supernova, it does lose a lot of its mass. However, in order to maintain angular momentum, it has to spin faster now [1]. Much faster. And when it does, it emits a blast of radiation along its magnetic field lines. When observed from earth, we see a pulsating beam of light. This is what gives birth to a pulsar.

skill_name: Guess the name : Musical Instruments Quiz
skill_description: Hey there, are you looking for a game which is fun to play and also educates you in learning new things in the process. Well, you have come to the right place. Our skill aims to help people recognize and differentiate between the sounds of different musical instruments using a fun quiz.   How to play: 1. You will be asked a question followed by an instrument sound. Each question will have multiple choice answers.  2. Guess the instrument by listening to the sound. To give your answer, either repeat the number(one, two, three etc.) of the option or repeat the option value (drums, guitar, harmonica etc.)  3. After each set of questions, you will be given a score and the game will end. 4. You can play again, to get a new set of sounds. NOTE: At any point in the game, say, START OVER, to restart the game or REPEAT, to repeat the question.

If you haven't yet grasped these operations yet, use this skill's practice mode to take time and gain mastery!  Feeling confident about your mastery? How many multiplication and division questions can you get right in a row? 10, 20, 100? Try to beat your personal best across multiple sessions with this engaging skill. You can choose between three activities: reciting, test and streak challenge.  Reciting is a way to quickly memorize an individual times table by listening and chanting along with Alexa who recites the multiples, for example, "4, 8, 12, 16", etc. Then, when you're feeling confident to take a test, Alexa will give you a series of random questions for a given times table and check your responses, for example, "what is 6 times 4?", "16 divided by 4?", etc. During the test, Alexa notes the incorrect answers and repeats those questions, until you get all correct. Kind of like flash cards, just spoken.  In this skill, times tables can go up to 16 by 16 which is the top, "hard" level. You begin at the "easy" level with tables of up to 8 by 8, while the middle level is called "moderate" with tables of up to 12 by 12. You can change the difficulty level at any time by saying, for example, "set level to moderate". If you're feeling pretty confident at a certain level, you can try the streak challenge. Unlike with a normal test, in a streak, Alexa asks questions across all times tables of your current level. The streak breaks with the first incorrect answer. Each correct answer brings points based on the difficulty of the question and as you progress Alexa keeps a total score. Alexa also tracks your personal best across multiple sessions and will congratulate you every time you beat it. If you need to leave in a hurry, just say "pause" and your streak will automatically resume next time you open the skill. Questions in tests and streaks also include real-life problems, such as: "Grandma is baking scones for the family of 5. How many does she need to bake if they all eat 4 scones each?" Most questions come with hints which are offered automatically if you wait for too long with an answer, or you can just say "help". For example, on a question "what is 9 times 6" the hint would be: "if you know what 10 times 6 is, just subtract 6 from that". All tests and streaks include division questions, which come up randomly in about a third of all questions.

skill_description: Is your child studying math at school? Or are you looking to brush up on your own math? Eureka Eleven Plus, which publishes exam preparation materials, offers this AI-powered Math Masterclass tutorial game as a free service to our readers. AT HOME or IN CAR At home, on any Amazon Echo speaker or display. Driving with a child? Use any Android or iPhone. (1) Download the Alexa app. (2) Press the big blue button. When blue light appears, say "Open Math Tutor". (3) Works best when direct to phone rather than through in-car bluetooth. COMMANDS TO TRY WAIT (Amazon forces session to close unless you keep asking for more time) REPEAT HINT  NEW (fresh question) SCORE (gives your progress report) AIM Get the answers right first time, without needing hints on the method, and to achieve this quickly. High Five Maths by Learning Mole and ProfileTree is a fun and interactive maths quiz suitable for ages 5-10. This Alexa Skill is perfect resource to challenge children and it also provides support to develop their mental maths skills. It’s very simple to use: · Wake up the App · Choose a level · Begin your quiz – 5 questions will be provided · Say’ Repeat’ if you would like to hear a question again or need more time to answer · Tell Alexa your answers – you will have 8 seconds to answer each question · Can you answer all 5 questions correctly? High Five Maths is an easy, fun way to practise mental maths with children. It can be used in the classroom, for home-schooling, at home or independently by the children themselves. The skill gives immediate feedback, gives children time to answer questions and allows the questions to be repeated. It is perfect for building number fluency and speed in mental calculations. The levels have been designed to suit differing age ranges and abilities as well as being closely related to curriculum concepts. The levels are matched with age but feel free to explore the range to find which one suits best. · Level 1 – Age 5-6 · Level 2 – Age 6-7 · Level 3 – Age 7-8 · Level 4 – Age 8-9 · Level 5 – Age 9-10 High Five Maths is a great resource for developing listening skills and understanding, a great way to start the day or give children a challenge throughout the day. It can also be used as part of an end of week quiz, giving an insight into the concepts that children are understanding or that they may still require some support with. The app has been developed by Michelle Connolly - a teacher with over 16 years teaching experience both internationally and throughout the UK and Ireland. Michelle also runs Learning Mole, an educational platform which specialises in supporting parents, guardians, teachers and everyone involved in the childcare sector to enhance children’s learning and development. You don't need any special hardware for this Skill and can even use it on your phone. It's an easy and free addition to your children's learning kit. Just activate "Kids Skills" on your phone, enable the skill and you are ready to go. Enjoy learning and have fun.

Do you want to train your brain? Do you want to improve your spelling, but don't like those boring and badly working spelling skills? Then Clever Count is the right skill for you! Clever Count is not only the perfect skill for children, but also for adults who enjoy giving their brain a small exercise session.  Clever Count has been developed to train the brain in translating simple to complex words into characters and help to improve our spelling.  Alexa will tell you a word and you will have to count the number of letters it has. It contains around 9000 different words and allows you to vary between three difficulty levels, easy, medium and hard. There are some special features included into this brain trainer, such as occasionally asking you to count the number of vowels in a word when you are playing on difficulty level hard.  To start training, you will need to enable access to Kid Skills in your Alexa app, as this game is for both children and adults. After that, just say "Alexa, start clever count." to start a new training session. Alexa will then set the difficulty level according to your preferences and start asking you for the number of letters in different words, and all you have to do is respond with a number. It is as simple as that! If you are done training, just simply say "stop" and Alexa will not only tell you the number of words, of which you counted the number of letters correctly in this practise session, but also the total number across all sessions.  This is all you need to know to start training your brain. Go ahead and try it out! A few helpful features you should know about: If you need help at any point, just say "help" and Alexa will explain to you the game mechanics. If you didn't properly understand the word Alexa said, just ask her to repeat it.  If you feel like changing the difficulty level, feel free to tell Alexa to change it for you. If you want to delete your statistics and want a fresh start, just say "delete my profile" and Alexa will obey your command.  Be sure to rate Clever Count and tell us if you enjoyed it!

Bedtime Prayers is a skill to help children develop the habit of saying prayers at the end of their day. When you launch the skill or ask it for a prayer, the skill selects one from a small library of prayers.  Our prayers are all short and intended for children at bedtime.  Alexa says the prayer slowly, so that children and their families can easily follow along and join in. Be sure to tell any babysitters about the skill too.  It might help them keep children in their nighttime routine. After the first prayer, you can ask to repeat the same prayer, ask Alexa for another prayer, or just say goodnight. Some things you can say: To start the skill: "Alexa, open Bedtime Prayers." "Alexa, launch Bedtime Prayers." "Alexa, ask Bedtime Prayers to say a prayer." After hearing a prayer: "Repeat the prayer." "Say another prayer." "Goodnight." Parents can also say: "Add my prayer", to learn how to suggest your own prayer to add to the skill. "I like this", to hear how to send the skill's creator feedback. You can also say "Help" for examples of things you can say to this skill. Some of our prayers are traditional, and some may be contributed by users of this skill.  If you have a favourite bedtime prayer that children in your family have enjoyed, why not send it to us and we may add it in a future update. Please leave us a nice rating and a comment if you enjoy this simple skill.  By the way, we'd love to add more prayers contributed by our faithful users.  So if you'd like us to consider adding a family favourite of yours, just let us know by leaving a review in the Alexa app or skills store.  Your contributions, ratings and reviews encourage us to keep improving this skill.   Thanks!

Animal A B C's is a fun game for children who are learning the alphabet and the sounds that letters make.  The game follows a pattern of Alexa stating a letter and  a corresponding animal name which begins with that letter. Alexa spells the word, repeats the first phrase, and then invites the child to say the phrase.  Here's an example: "A is for alligator." "Alligator is spelled a, l, l, i, g, a, t, o, r." "A is for alligator." "Now it is your turn.  Say "A is for alligator."   Alexa listens for the response before moving to the next letter.  The game is loaded with three different animals (where available) for each letter.  These are presented randomly, so that there is an enormous number of unique variations for this game.   Your child won't be bored by playing the same game over and over again!  When Alexa reaches Z, she gives the child an option to play again.  The child can choose to begin at the beginning, or anywhere from A to Z, just by choosing a letter.  We hope you will love Animal ABC's and let us know by leaving us a 5-star review.  Your feedback gives us reason to keep developing more great skills for Alexa.  To begin, just say "Alexa, open Animal ABC's."  You can also say, "Alexa, play Animal ABC's" or "Alexa, start Animal ABC's.  Happy learning!

Are you scared of being exposed as a "fraud"? skill_name: Three Wishes Cairo Book 2: Story Theater Enabled
skill_description: The Adventure Continues... Aladdin is a thief. After a chance meeting with a young princess, his life spirals out of control when it is revealed that dark forces control the power of the throne. By chance, he discovers the magic lamp and three wishes that could either save his life or doom him forever. More immersive reading for young adventurers! Story Theater is an exciting new system that makes you part of the adventure.  You'll read along, read aloud and eagerly anticipate the next turn of the page. You can try the system for free.  Just say "Alexa, play Three Wishes Cairo Book Two." When the narrator says, "It's your turn to read," just say "Next".  You'll instantly become part of an exciting serial adventure tale that will make everyone eager to see what happens next. If you enjoy the experience, you can explore the entire system by purchasing the companion illustrated book here on Amazon.  https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C4R51WH Parents:  Story Theater is designed for kids.  We make it so that your child develops a lifelong love of reading.  The system moves forward using prompts read by your child which trigger narration, sound effects, music, background sounds...even Alexa herself in an age appropriate exciting adventure. Math facts fluency refers to the ability to recall the basic facts in all four operations accurately, quickly and effortlessly.  When students achieve automaticity with these facts, they have attained a level of mastery that enables them to retrieve them for long-term memory without conscious effort or attention.  Brain imaging studies have shown how the progression from effortful processes, such as finger counting, to automatized retrieval is associated with actual changes in the regions of the brain involved in mathematical computation. This trainer starts off at grade 3 recommended math fluency level and then adjusts to higher or lower difficulties based on the answers to your last ten questions. This is the initial version, made with the help of my two kids who are in elementary school. Please provide feedback on what you like or don't like and we'll incorporate that in future revisions.

Want to know what is special about today? or, What was special on 10 December 2016? and even, What will be special on 15 June 2018? Then just enable this amazing skill in the Alexa app. Now, never miss any of the important things about today. It is developed specially for children and senior citizens to keep them up to date with their knowledge about every day of the year. How does it works? We have enriched this skill with an extra ordinary , high tech calendar data base that remains up to the minute.  All you need to do is ask "Alexa, What special today? ". And, she will get you the everything related to today, on the go. One of the many astonishing features of this skill , is that you can even know about the specialty  of previous and the upcoming dates. For an instance, if you ask "Alexa, what was special on 22 March 2018?" She will reply you that it was "World Water Day".  Similarly , for 5 June 2018, she will say "World Environment Day". What you will need for this Skill? Following is the prerequisites  for this great skill: •Amazon Alexa App. •Amazon Echo device. •A valid Amazon ID  and Password. •A proficient Wi-Fi network. •Device to operate the Alexa app such as phone, tablet or PC. How to enable the skill? To enable the Skill, go through these steps: •Click on the enable the skill above. •And, follow the onscreen instructions. Or, •Open your Alexa app with your Amazon credentials. • Navigate to "Settings". •Click on "Skills". •Type and search for  "What special today?" •Select the appropriate Skill. •Click on enable, then enable now. And, you're good to go.
