The "Subtraction Spot Quiz" helps adults and seniors to test subtraction skills by asking five basic questions, such as :  What is "9 minus 5” , thus providing good cognitive workout.  For example, a user can say "Alexa, Open Subtraction Quiz" to start the quiz. In case, if user unable to find the question they can say "repeat"  to repeat the same question. Spot Quizzes helps your brain by giving a good cognitive workout on a regular basis which may help reduce the risk for developing types of dementia, including Alzheimer's in seniors. As per research, mental stimulation helps to reduce forgetfulness, memory loss, and slowed reasoning or thinking skills in the elderly demographics.   You may also want to enable similar 'Spot Quiz' skills, viz. 1) Addition Spot Quiz 2) Multiplication Spot Quiz 3) Division Spot Quiz     For suggestions and feedback, please reach us at alexa@nectarspot.com
Quadratic Formula solver takes the three coefficients given by the user in alphabetical order, and uses the numbers to calculate the two solutions for the quadratic formula.

Get the kids involved and see how well they do in their multiplication times tables. Mental Maths will test how well they know their multiplications up to the 12 times tables by default. This is great if you just want them to brush up on mental arithmetic or just to get the brain stimulated! Just  ask Alexa to open 'Mental Maths" and it will test you on your times tables. The skill will give you the result of your test after 12 randomly selected questions. If you don't know the answer on a question, you  can just say "pass" or "don't know" Remember to speak clearly when answering the questions. MULTIPLE UPDATES: ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set difficulty, E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, ask Mental Maths to set difficulty to Hard'. The difficulty levels are  - Easy - up to 8  - Medium - up to 12  - Hard - up to 16  - Very Hard - up to 20 By default Medium (up to 12 is selected) ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set question type, E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to ask me division questions'. The question types are Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction and Random By default Multiplication is selected  ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set the number of questions to be asked, E.g. say: ----->    'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to set number of questions to 10'. By default number of questions asked is 12 ----------------------------------------------------- Has Teach Mode to learn a specific number (Multiplactions) E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to teach me the 9 times tables ----------------------------------------------------- Has Test or Practice Mode to practice a specific number E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to test me  on the 9 times tables ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to track progress E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to send my report'. Read the stats of your scores by viewing the Alexa app, and be sure to check out the unique link showing your scores Watch your child improve their maths by seeing the stats in the provided link in the Alexa App.

The "Multiplication Spot Quiz" may help adults and seniors to test multiplication skills by asking five basic questions, such as :  what is " 9 * 5” thus providing good cognitive workout.  In case, if user unable to find the question they can say "repeat"  to repeat the same question. Spot Quizzes helps your brain by giving a good cognitive workout on a regular basis which may help reduce the risk for developing types of dementia, including Alzheimer's in seniors. As per research, mental stimulation helps to reduce forgetfulness, memory loss, and slowed reasoning or thinking skills in the elderly demographics.   You may also want to enable similar 'Spot Quiz' skills, viz. 1) Addition Spot Quiz 2) Subtraction Spot Quiz 3) Division Spot Quiz     For suggestions and feedback, please reach us at alexa@nectarspot.com

This skill allows the user to ask for a Maths question. Once a question has been asked the use will then respond with the answer. If the answer is correct or incorrect the user will be told. If incorrect the user can answer again with the correct number. To get another question, the used will ask for another question. The type of question and the numbers involved are random. To get started say "Alexa ask Maths Game to ask me a question". Alexa will then ask you a Maths question. Say the answer as a number only. For example "five". For another question, say "Ask me a question". Alternatively, say "Alexa ask Maths Game to ask me an easy question". Alexa will then ask you an easy Maths question. Say the answer as a number only. For example "five".

Solving word problems allow children to apply math concepts to solve real world problems. With this skill, Alexa can help your child practice solving word problems and in the process learn and improve math problem solving skills. Word problems are an important tool for children to relate math to real world problems, and often bring together various math concepts into one problem. It helps your child learn to comprehend the problem when spoken, think visually and use creativity to solve the word problems. Once you ask Alexa - Word Problems skill to ask a word problem, she can keep asking different problems till you choose to stop. You can ask her to repeat the question anytime, ask for the correct answer or ask for a different question. You can also ask Alexa the score, when she will tell you how many questions were correctly answered out of all she has asked in the current interaction.

Skip Count is a simple and interactive Alexa skill aimed at making learning to skip count fun. Skill helps reinforce the concept of counting from 1 to 100 and also count in increments. Safe and Suitable for children and adults of any age. No personal information collected by the skill.

My ABC is a fun, simple, and easy-to-use skill that will jump-start learning the English alphabet and beginner words. To make it interesting and engaging, there are animal sounds and rhymes/songs to sing along and learn. Things you can do with the skill: The “ALPHABET” feature, as the name suggests, teaches A to Z with a pace that is easy to follow. The 'Alexa, repeat' option can be used at any point to replay.   The “WORD” feature lists multiple sets of common words, animal and bird names along with the sounds they make. The “SONG" feature will play the rhymes. To know the list of songs/rhymes, say “Alexa, list songs”. The “SPELLING" feature will spell the word. Just say “Alexa, spell world”. The skill is simple and responsive. You can switch between Alphabet, Songs and Word anytime by just saying “Alexa, alphabet”, “Alexa, song" or “Alexa, word” to initiate the respective feature.  The friendly helper invoked by saying “Alexa, help” will provide details about the skill and its capabilities.  Happy listening and happy learning!
Performs a version of the alphabet song.
Simple skill that allows parents to tell Alexa to tell their kids to do things.
Ask Alexa for a phone fact and it will give you one randomly.

When you choose your subject, addition, subtraction,  multiplication or division, you'll be given 40 seconds to solve as many problems as you can.  If you can solve 6 questions correctly, you can move on to the next level with more difficult problems. On the menu mode, you can ask 'What's my score?' to track your score. Problems at the higher level will give you more points.
This skill gives you random nursery rhymes. You can also ask for a rhyme by title. Included are children's classics such as Jack and Jill, Humpty Dumpty, and This Little Piggy.

"Times Tables", ask you multiplication questions. You can set the amount of questions you'd like to be asked. Alexa ask Times Tables to give me ten questions You can also choose the difficulties of the questions. Alexa ask Times Tables for hard questions Very Easy up to 4 * 4 Easy up to 8 * 8  Medium up to 12 * 12, this is the default Hard up to 16 * 16 Very Hard up to 20 * 20

Musical chairs is a game where a number of chairs, one fewer than the number of players, are arranged facing outward with the players standing in a circle just outside the chairs. Ask Alexa to play Musical Chairs and start in walking around the chairs. When the music stops each player attempts to sit down in one of the chairs. The player who is left without a chair is eliminated from the game. One chair is then removed/eliminated to ensure that there will always be one fewer chair than there are players.

Let Alexa solve your family's movie night woes. Tell Alexa your families favorite movies and have her pick at random one of those awesome movies you always want to watch again.  In my house, we had a candy jar filled with paper scraps with names of  movies we love for us and the kids. On a movie night, one of my three kids would pick a movie title from the jar to watch. Of course, they would never agree, because Ryan chose or because Meg chose. Good news is we can let Alexa pick! Just start the skill and ask "What movie should I  watch?". Problem solved since Alexa chose !  The skill is fun and can be funny but most of all it stops your kids from bickering and allows you to enjoy a fun loving family movie night !  Psst, you can really use this skill for any movies you may want to watch just tell Alexa what to add and "Family Movie Roulette" will pick.

The questions are related to the events, characters and their preferences in the most popular kids TV series "SpongeBob Squarepants". We play this trivia all the time at home and my kids thought it would be a fun idea to play with Alexa!

Alexa will ask you 5 random multiplication questions from the 0 to 12 times tables.  After each answer, Alexa will tell you if you answered correctly.  After the final question, Alexa will tell you your score out of 5.  If you tell Alexa to stop you won't get a score out of 5.

skill_name: Mindful States - facts about US states
skill_description: Created by a father and daughter team, this skill is a great way to learn and practice a variety of facts about US states. We started with the states and capitals to help her study for her 4th grade states & capitals quiz, and it was so much fun that we kept adding more facts!! She did all of the research, and she even wrote most of the code. We hope you have as much fun using it as we did creating it! Here are the types of facts you can ask about: State Capital State Flower State Motto State Bird State Grass State Rose State Rock State Nickname State Abbreviation Coordinates Timezone Latitude Longitude Region Population Governor Lt. Governor What do you call someone from the state Date the state joined the union Order in which the state was admitted Territory the state originally belonged to What is next to the state --You can even say "I'd like a random state fact" and see what Alexa offers up! Provided by Mindful Gaming, Inc. (c) 2017

Simple Math Facts will ask you 5 simple addition questions.  The numbers are random between 0 and 12.  The skill will tell you if you answered correctly or not.  At the end of the 5 questions it will give you the number of questions you answered correctly.

Word Buddy helps kids learn the plural form of words and the group name for animals. Simply start Word Buddy and ask it: what do you call more than one tooth? Or what is the plural of fox? If you want to know the name of animal group, ask Word Buddy: what do you call a group of ducks (or other animal)?
Easy math, is a fun way to test elementary addition skills. More skills will be added soon
Here you can ask about capital city of any country.

"Times Tables", ask you multiplication questions. You can set the amount of questions you'd like to be asked. Alexa ask Times Tables to give me ten questions You can also choose the difficulties of the questions. Alexa ask Times Tables for hard questions Very Easy up to 4 * 4 Easy up to 8 * 8  Medium up to 12 * 12, this is the default Hard up to 16 * 16 Very Hard up to 20 * 20

Wallace's Kids makes animal sounds.  You can ask Wallace's Kids  to speak an animal sound and they will answer you back.  Sometimes, Wallace Kids had helpers and they added different animal sounds so try a second time and you may get a different sound or one from a different person. For example, say "Alexa ask Wallace's Kids what does a cat say? You can also ask Wallace's Kids to list all the animals they know the sounds of.  Just say, "Alexa ask Wallace's Kids what animal sounds can you say?"
Haven't you always been intrigued by the majestic creature known as the seahorse? Now you can learn all about seahorses from your Amazon Echo with this Alexa Skill.

Micki My teaches you a little ditty made famous by the Three Stooges, with help from Professor Moe and others along the way.  Make a request using only a consonant from the alphabet (vs a vowel) lest you be scolded. Open Micki My by saying things like "Open Micki My" or "Load Micki My".  Make a request by saying things like "Do Micki My for the letter D" or "Do Micki My D".  You can both open the app and make a request in one-shot by saying things like "Open Micki My for the letter D".

Let's Add is a skill that quizzes you on addition problems.  You can specify how high you want the questions to go, up to twenty plus twenty.  Once you set how high you want to be quizzed on, Let's Add will ask you if you want the questions to be in order, or random. As you are learning addition you may want to start in order, then as you get better and need to be challenged, you can try random problems.  You can say "repeat" to hear a problem again if you didn't hear it the first time.   You can start over any time by saying "Start Over", or just say the new addition problem maximum values you want to go to, such as "five plus five".  At any time you can say "stop" or "cancel" and you will be told the number of correct answers you gave, and the number of incorrect answers you gave, out of the total possible addition problems.  So have fun, and learn to add. Send suggestions, comments, pictures of Alexa teaching you addition, etc., to  support@wobblemouth.com.   I'm looking for new ideas to make learning fun with Alexa. Version 1.0.0

To use Times Table, try saying... Alexa, Open Times Table Alexa says times table math problem and you need to say the correct answer. For example, Alexa says "six times three". The correct response is "eighteen". You get three chances to give the correct answer for each math problem. The game continues until you stop the game. You can ask for help by saying “help”, get a new math problem by saying “new”, or stop the game by saying “stop” or "cancel" to end your game. If you fail to respond in time, that's ok. Just re-open Times Table and it picks up where you left off.

It is an interactive algebra training game. It randomly generates addition,subtraction, multiplication or division questions and ask users to give the answer. The maximum factor number involved in addition and subtraction is 99. And the maximum factor number involved in multiplication and division is 20. It is aimed for primary school algebra training.

“Cock-a-doodle-doo” - which animal makes that sound? Listen alone or with friends to real animal sounds and guess the animal. With each correct guess, you advance to the next, more difficult level, and earn a title! Will you be the first to master all ten levels? To launch this quiz, say “Start zoo walk”. During the game, you can say "Repeat", "Stop" or "What's the high score". For further assistance, say "Help".

Math Dog is your personal math tutor, giving you math problems to solve with increasing difficulty as you master each level.  Questions start with basic addition, and progress up to include subtraction, multiplication and division.
This app contains a quiz for 25 animal sounds. This will be perfect for children trying to recognize animals voices and interact with Alexa to show their knowledge.

Alexa will tell an interesting Physics fact for your kids with this skill enabled. You can use it to inspire your kids to learn more about science or encourage them to seek for information about what Alexa has just said but they don't quite understand yet. More relevant facts will be added to the pool of about 70 facts at the moment. Credit: Physics facts were curated and edited from http://www.sciencekids.co.nz/.
A flash card skill for kids to use to practice memorizing subtraction.

This Amazon Skill Set  mission is to educate people of internet who lust for information. To provide easily accessible information we sorted various articles into categories like technology, science, astronomy, interesting facts.
Mathematical Trivia. Solve divisions, multiplications, sums and subtractions in your mind, and improve your mental calculation skills.

This skill asks the player a series of basic arithmetic math card questions; addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It picks random numbers between 0 and 9 for the questions.  Just say the answer.  For example:  Alexa says, "What is 9 + 9?" You answer, "18" Alexa says, “Correct, what is…” While practicing, you can also say things like: “I don’t know” “I want to do [addition, subtraction multiplication, division, or random]” “Repeat” “Stop”

Ask Alexa to make the sounds of your favorite animals. She learns new animal sounds all the time and is doing her best to imitate them. Don't be afraid when you hear her roar like a lion. She probably won't eat you. HOW DOES IT WORK? Just ask your Alexa to open the animal sounds skill.  Each time you open the skill we will play a random animal sound and then give you the option to hear another animal sound or to play an animal sound guessing game. You can say… - Alexa, open Animal Sounds - Alexa, tell Animal Sounds to play a guessing game - Alexa, ask Animal Sounds to imitate any animal - Alexa, tell Animal Sounds imitate a Lion - Alexa, ask Animal Sounds what animals sounds can you make Here are a few you should try: baboon, bear, bobcat, cat, cow, coyote, hippopotamus, lemur, lion, spider, monkey, spider monkey, rooster, and many more. This skill is made for kids and never collects any personal data.  If you haven't enabled kid skills on your Amazon account, a parent or guardian will be prompted provided permission to use kid skills when enabling this skill.     WHO BUILT THIS SKILL? This skill was developed by RAIN's voice innovation team.  RAIN helps brands innovate with voice at the intersection of marketing and technology.

Math Tutor can read out the multiplication tables between 1 and 10. For example, you could say "Alexa, ask Math Tutor for 6 times table." Alexa will then read the answer, which is also available to view on the Home page of the Echo App.

Let's Multiply is a skill that quizzes you on your multiplication table.  You can specify how high you want the questions to go, up to twelve times twelve.  Once you set how high you want to be quizzed on, Let's Multiply will ask you if you want the questions to be in order, or random. As you are learning your multiplication table you may want to start in order, then as you get better and need to be challenged, you can try random problems.  You can say "repeat" to hear a problem again if you didn't hear it the first time.   You can start over any time by saying "Start Over", or just say the new table high value you want to go to, such as "five times five".  At any time you can say "stop" or "cancel" and you will be told the number of correct answers you gave, and the number of incorrect answers you gave, out of the total possible math problems.  So have fun, and learn your multiplication table. Send suggestions, comments, pictures of Alexa teaching you multiplication, etc., to  support@wobblemouth.com.   I'm looking for new ideas to make learning fun with Alexa. Version 1.1.0 - Improved voice recognition handling and processing - Fixed a defect that occasionally caused the skill to stop responding
